content:
Posted: July 14, 2016
												[EDIT 3/29/17: They're removing the weekend's unlimited Stamina perks. And just like that any motivation I had for the already needlessly tedious grinding is completely gone.]=Pros= It looks cool and the story's good. That's it.And now for the bigger list. Just saying, don't let my hours spent playing fool you.=Cons=  - Counter-intuitive mid to late-game combat goes completely against what you were taught before. If you're a newcomer to any dungeon past Feita, forget about winning without an OP party that barely gives you any opportunity to do anything.Have fun losing your revives to a massively difficulty-spiked boss and being made fun of rather than helped.- Community is among the worst I've seen in my life with regards to how they handle new players. They'll badger you for lucky pulls from boxes (which will come few and far between unless you open your wallet like some retard), but that's about it. Hate is tossed around between players a lot, especially where the bullsh~~ PvP is involved.- Unholy-bad problem with class balance. This, in a nutshell, is why I quit taking PvP seriously and only do it for sh~~s and giggles with friends. While some characters are built very well, there are others such as Eve that can barely do a god-darned thing on her own and others still that are so godlike compared to everyone else that they just crush all opposition with little to no resistance (Add, Elesis, Lu/Ciel, etc).- Unless you figure out every little trick and trigger in the book like a tryhard who has nothing better to do with their time, I'm fairly certain even going by so-called "Pay2Win" will not help you. The mid to late game will take just about every opportunity to punish you by chopping off around half your health simply for being in the wrong place at the wrong time once (which, more often than not, newcomers will not be able to tell when that is), and it doesn't help that there are way too many windows for that to happen with how long it takes to kill things later unless you have those stupid +11 weapons that are next to impossible to build anyway with how low enhancement success rates are.- Don't play solo when aiming for levels. EVER. It takes way too freaking long, and even with a party in tow you'll find yourself repeating segments of the game way more than any sane person should.- Annoying notifications about who did what 24/7, which by the way get in the way of your experience and stamina bars so you can't see them.- Storage space is too small, and you have to pay to expand it. The amount of times I've had to sell, dismantle, or throw away useless armor and weapons well below my level is downright disgusting.- I mentioned this before, but the equipment enhancement system is hands-down the WORST I have seen in ANY game. I'm convinced I could play against FF12's infamous superboss Yiazmat and (somehow) beat it, and it would not take nearly as long as it would to get a decent late-game weapon in this game because of how low enhancement success rates are, and the consequences for LUCK-BASED FAILURE are ridiculous; sometimes nothing will happen, others your equipment will LOSE a grade or even drop all the way back down to a +0, or it will outright break for no good reason.- Same goes for enchanting effects time-wise. It takes way too long to get just one necessary material, and if you're looking for anything specific then good luck because all of the in-game ways to get them are completely random and few and far between (some of which will have you again chancing death).I could go on for hours about how many sloppy design choices this game made. Yes, it is free to play and some things can be fun THE FIRST TIME, but with how much of a stupid grind-fest it quickly becomes and how asininely and increasingly unfair and unforgiving it becomes to newer players (Dark Souls and classic NES games are more forgiving than this game is), even if you're looking for some kind of time waster I would ultimately say... look somewhere else. This game will not do new guys any favors unless they're prepared to pour out their wallets (and I can't guarantee even that will help you). Do I find it fun? Kinda, but I'm highly doubtful you will.

content:
Posted: October 1, 2015
												This game is absolutely awful, the older, original characters (Elsword - Eve) are completely outclassed by any of the later characters (with some minor exceptions). Therefore, if you like competitive PvP at all your best bet is going to be 1 or 2 classes, Add and Luciel at the moment. Additionally, if you aren't in NA you may experience Elsword's Laggers, you will be staring at your screen watching someone warp around everywhere while their skills buffer randomly and end up killing you, fun.The leveling is trash, it consists of doing the same dungeon 3 times, once on any difficulty, again on hard and again on very hard, for EVERY dungeon. Once you get up to skill notes and job changes they consist of grinding the same dungeons sometimes upwards of 20 times or paying $5 USD.Which brings me to the cash shop, sure it's a free to play game but, it may as well not be, you start off with a ridiculously small inventory which you have to pay about $2 USD to expand by 8 slot, 8 SLOTS, to top it off you need to buy these for every one of the inventory cateregories : Special, Inventory, Consumable, Item, Quest, you'd need to pay $10 USD just to upgrade each of those inventories by a measly 8 slots (not enough, so you more have to spend about $30 USD just go get enough inventory space). Then there's the costumes, they cost about $30 USD each and if you want to play competitive PvP good luck without a costume, also, if you want to play Luciel you need 2 costumes so $60. The worst part is: costumes and inventories aren't shared across characters so, that $30 USD you just spent on your main character's inventory, yep, you need to spend another $30 for every other character you want to play on,Please don't play this game, it's Nexon's second Maplestory and is nothing but a shameless attempt to grab as much $$$ as possible.

												Yes, It doesn't say I've played elsword on steam, but off steam, i've had over 3 years of gameplay.This game is EXTREMELY fun, it is a great game but, i cannot recommend it due to the overpriced pieces on the NA server. It'll take around a whole month of playing to get a good top piece, just buy dungeoning. The only other way your gonna get that is by spending alot of damn money for the piece. Some of the pieces are worth over 100$, just with in-game money that'd take years to get. THE PVP IS COMPLETELY UNBALANCED. All the characters in the game are just not balanced. They have their cons and pros, but some characters, only have pros, no cons at all. Some even only have cons considering how stupidly weak they are. Onto the pay 2 win topic again, every expensive top piece gives stats, you need a whole set for more stats, you need money to get +11, probably over 100$ just to ATTEMPT.If your glad to spend alot money on a game. Go right ahead, and you'll have one FUN time in this game. OTHERWISE, don't even bother downloading, getting the highest rank in the game probably will require you to spend around 500$. Getting to level 70 isn't as hard as it used to be.The only good part in the pay 2 win scene in this game is, Elsword even gives chances to get some pretty good weapons, for instance, i spent nothing and got probably 15$ worth of items without even an event. Events give you the chance to get new and cool sets.Overall my rating is 9/10 to the game. But unfortunately spending is the only way your gonna enjoy it. THIS IS NOT A FREE TO PLAY GAME!IGN: Fistomatic

content:
Posted: May 6, 2016
												This game is the very definition of free-to-play & pay-to-win. It literally takes the♥♥♥♥♥♥of the phrase and transcends the very meaning of "micro"-transaction.While the game can seldom be fun in its repetitive PVE grind-quests, the PVP is a complete joke. If you actually expect to stand a chance in PVP, you'll need to shell out $50+ of real money before you even start - like every opponent you'll ever face in there, assuming they aren't either hacking the game, exploiting their character's imbalance of the month, or stunlocking you in a never-ending combo until you lose while they gloat about how♥♥♥♥♥♥you are as they teleport around the map due to their♥♥♥♥♥♥internet connection.Want gloves for your character? 500 K-Ching ($5.00).A full outfit since you're stuck with no clothes and looking like a peasant noob? 5,000 K-Ching ($50).The prices are obscene and KOG knows they can get away with it because mindless ♥♥♥♥wits will openly pay it because they think prices like those are okay. Which sets a lovely example for the new generation of gamers. Not only this, but at every corner/turn/etcetera, this game gives out free items that last for a matter of hours before disappearing. If you want the item, you'll have to pay these kinds of prices for it. Literally just a way to tease players and coax them into♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥away their money.And you know what? The greed doesn't stop there. There's a marketplace in the game and there's just as much greed there as there is from the developers. Some people actually expect you to pay hundreds of billions of in-game cash (ED) for the things you want.Literally gaming at its worst. I'm not even going to check the box asking if I got this for free because I've spent the equivalent of two brand new AAA games and still got ♥♥♥♥all out of it. I feel cheated by this game. If there's anything this game succeeded in doing it's this: It made me realize how bad this issue is getting in games today and I promise both this company and the next that I will not touch their game should it include microtransactions.I had two friends who got totally and irrevocably consumed by this game and now spend every penny of real money they earn in it ($150 a month minimum) and won't listen to anything I have to say on the matter. I fear that when they're 25 they'll still be playing this joke of a game and spending all of their earnings on it and will both wind up homeless in the future or something. One of them won't even talk to me anymore because they don't want to hear what I have to say.I would have recommended this game for the purpose of showing people what gaming is not, but I don't want others to fall victim to this horse♥♥♥♥♥♥and other games that follow suit.This last point I'm going to make isn't directly tied to the quality of the game itself but more at the community. I once had a guild in this game called MaliciousEntity and at some point I added a guy who told me some sadsack story and since I felt bad I made him an admin. After that, he took over my guild and it wasn't mine anymore. I ended up leaving and taking my closest friends there with me. Apparently, a friend of mine looked up my guild in the game and he found that a few months down the line, the guy I handed my guild over to bet my guild in a guild war or something and lost horribly, with a score of like 0-32. So my guild was handed over to the other and it was renamed to "rA". Maybe my guild will be in better hands with them, because it surely didn't mean much to the guy I initially gave it to.TL;DR:Story: 7/10.PVE: 6/10.PVP: Lol ♥♥♥♥ you.Visuals: 5/10.Community: 2/10Microtransactions=True.Overall: 2.0/10.

number of helpful: 47 of 79 people (59%) found this review helpful9 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 4, 2015
												FULL Warning, if someone is planning to read this, be aware this is a long review.Elsword is game that is, like a lot of games nowadays, a game i call 'Junk Food', is good, very good, but only for a while.The Story is simple, nothing mind-blowing, this is both a con and a pro.Since it is simple in generic terms, is nothing special and for so, it doesn't stick out from other games.On the contrary, this eases the player getting into it and makes it easy to understand and value, still i will say this is a case where the plot is maybe... too simple...The aesthetics and visuals are most impressive, in this point in time, nigh-every game is out to look edgy and serious, for so, making Elsword all the more special with its unique anime style artwork and graphics.The characters models, on the other hand are... Meh, driven by their artwork, i was expecting a much more cleaner and precise model, the models look nowhere near as good or detailed as the artworks and at first it bothered the hell outta me, i will say i like almost all of the suits for nearly everyone, but i wish Job Change clothes didn't expire, smart people will see is a cheap way of the developers saying "Want to look good again? Load up money and buy some sh¡t".I will not sh¡t on the cloth clipping visual effects when you are wearing too much junk over since a lot of other games also have this issue, plus the fact that is not really a big deal and it doesn't have any relevant impact besides being glaring...Gameplay-wise, i will say Elsword has a very interesting concept and it pulls it off rather well, entering dungeons and combo-ing the sh¡t out of everything that is in the path along with visually impressive attack and a good amount of skills to dish out great amounts of pain without letting your enemies breathe is very satisfying and rewarding... When you learn to get those skills.Blazing through dungeons is very fun and appropiated party combo is a very cool thing to do, however if you are a person who gets dissoriented easily you might find yourself losing track of yourself and your actions due to the amount of shines, effects and explosions on the screen, which admittedly can become very annoying for some people.PvP, on the other hand, has to be the weakest part of the game for me, and i can say for nigh-everybody, the more they attempt to fix things, the more they♥♥♥♥♥♥up, not to mention that, if you have spent a good amount of hours in this game, getting to know the game as much as you could, the unbalance in PvP and how broken it is becomes more evident the more you level up and face people.Leveling up increases base stats like HP, Phy Atk/Def and Mag Atk/Def, also after certain level thresholds, you will be able to learn more skills that do increase your might and power to badazz proportions.In PvP however...Lets run down a list from the less impacting to the most obvious and annoying.1. Crappy Matchmaking System: I know everyone who has spent some decent hours in PvP did experience being like Lvl 30 and you are put to brawl agaisnt a Lvl 45 ~ 70, also when, since the PvP is Rank based (Standard stuff, the more you win matches, the more you Rank up), a beginner of Rank B can be placed to fight agaisnt a Rank A or S, it doesn't impact as much as the Lvl gap matches, but is still a very r3tard3d system.2. LAAAAAAG: Some say the Lag issues were probably inevitable, and to that i say bullsh¡t, i've played many games in which having a below-average internet didn't impacted much on the game itself and didn't made the experience completely suck balls, when you are PvPing (1v1, 2v2 or 3v3) and someone has lag, beating that son/daughter of a b¡tch just became a whole lot harder, in 1v1 the most annoying since if someone has lag, you will be unable to engage the foe in a combo since, you land the hit, but the damage and the flinch is inflicted after a period of time, making the entire concept of the game to be completely shot in the azz.This also applies to instances in PvP 2v2 ~ 3v3 where someone would activate Awakening or use a Special Active that causes Skill Freeze (Everyone in the Skill Freeze reach is immobile and unable to take action until hit or Skill Freeze ends), they are not affected or instances where the Skill Freeze is canceled by someone else who used another move that Skill Freezes, is hard to explain, but get to Lvl 70 and enter 2v2 SS Ranks matches and see for yourself.3: Character Disbalance: This, same as the issue with PvP Lag, becomes more apparent the more you progress and face players at higher levels, certain classes are CLEARLY better than others, being for mobility, damage, coverage or all of the above, this is even more obvious when you look at classes like LK, RS and IS and then you look at classes like LP and MM, and even if the previously issues are not present, some classes are just a cakewalk to use:EM: All she needs to do is XZZ or just keep running away and use Meditation or just stay still and camp MP, Some EMs may say "Duuude, we need a lot of MP to attack", and i say, once again, BULL. SH¡T. The moment you get MP, you use the MP, but you get a lot of MP, since EM has the biggest MP gain by attacks and almost all her attacks provide a great MP gain.Rena Classes:♥♥♥♥♥♥them all, To start, all of them noob Renas just spam ^X or ^^X to catch since is fast and has good coverage, don't be surprised if you are caught repeatedly by those noob Renas that just wait for you to approach them and ^X is the only thing they know to do, then there is what i consider to be the biggest facking bummer after Add, RENA'S AND AISHA'S TUMBLING.This abomination of a feature makes it a death-wish to throw Renas or Aisha into the air and hit them while airborne, if you do, they do a flip and as soon as they land, they can jump again, unlike all other characters that after landing, have a slight delay before being able to move, making it very easy for them to cassually hop out of your combos and back-firing you.ADDISON: This MOFO is the epidemy of Aimbot, almost all of his moves cover a good area, any commands he has are so easily spammable that a one-handed fetus with mental problems would be able to combo and nigh all of his moves are homing.He was made with the sh¡ttiest HP output, but you know that doesn't mean a damn when you can't even get close to touching him since he always has the screen bombarded with homing moves.4 and most important. Gear Difference: You can be the best of your kind, the number one as your class, however you face a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ that has a cutting-edge gear and wrecks you over in just a few single hits, Gear Carry is without a doubt the biggest facking problem of balance that helps unbalancing the already unbalanced PvP.Costume Parts, Costume Suits, Magic Amulets, Magic Stones, all of those, 90% requiring you to waste real-life money to get easily, these parts do build up a good chunk of your battle stats, and just with that gear boost, a completely ♥♥♥♥ing noob and idiotic player can pot shot a pro player effortlessly by just having the gear advantage, this becomes much more frecuent when you are on your road to SS and SSS, you will find players with absurd stats that with landing 15 hits on you is enough to take you down while you will have to strike them like a sewing machine to get remotely close to depleting a small slice of their HP.In the now PvP Season 3, the gear advantage is even more apparent as it can make playing serious PvP SERIOUSLY UNBEARABLE, More so when you are constantly being placed to fight agaisnt the same exact gear carried douch3bags who have obnoxiously strong gear sets, Even more so when they behave all mighty just because they have the gear upper-hand.Music: No need since music is subjective.END VEREDICT: As i said in the beggining of this review, this is JunkFood game, play it until you get to Level cap and had enough fun with PvP, then uninstall and change to another game.

content:
Posted: July 18, 2016
												I personally dont recommend this, for one, it fails to launch most of the time, and i have to go through uneeded methods just to play most of the time. Another thing is, everything in the items shop is too expensive, where 10 dollars could get you a pretty decent game here on steam hardly gets you jack squat in the items shop. Sure, you COULD get stuff from events but theres no garuntee that you'll have those forever. Not even the clothes you first start out with stick with you forever so  basically you're gonna probablly be walking around in your character's undergarments if, say, you come back to it 15 days later then poof! Its gone, not to mention if you want to actually BUY a costume to stick with you forever if you get one of their packages, can cost you up to 25 dollars or so, sure you could go for the 30 day option but that makes it so its pretty much not worth it to get it that long. Hell, the best costumes are locked behind ice burners and god knows how much money THAT could take just to get the full suit, same goes for mounts but worse, you cant even really buy them, and fossil readers dont garuntee you a mount either. Basically and eventually the game is going to make you feel, pathetically weak even if youre the highest level available unless you cough up some cash just to feel justifiably strong. Not to mention drop rates are horrid, most of the time youll be picking up equipment that wont even help you so you just end up selling it all the time till you magically just happen to pick up ONE item thatll benifit you. I could go on, but, i feel this has gone long enough. Overall if you REALLY want to play this game, go to Void elsword, everthing is more reasonable cash items wise and such and it overall feels more fun and is more functional than the official game overall save for some bugs and etc.(Apologies if this is bad, its my first review ever.)

content:
Posted: July 14, 2014
												What may be addicting and enjoyable for others turned out to be boring and overall frustrating for me.  The cash shop blatantly awards paying players an advantage over FTP's and provides all kinds of fast-tracks of progression which make playing without paying an agonizing experience.  Once you get to around level 30, which I did, you realize that many of the skills available to unlock require you to complete unbearably repetative tasks, and nearly ALL quests ask you to do the same thing, and that is "complete this long boring easy dungeon 5 times."  To get the items required to unlock skills, you have to do the same dungeon DOZENS of times.  There aren't really many available methods of leveling up, and around where I got I realized that there really isn't much content in this game.  6 or 7 zones total with 5 or so linear "kill-all-enemies-to-move-on" dungeons (can't recall the exact amount), that you will complete an inordinate number of times in order to progress through the game.  In order to make up for the marked lack of content, they slow down the progression systems with repetative quests, stamina, and slow exp gain.All of this, I say, would be excuseable if the combat system was phenomenal.  Well, I think it isn't, and this is where the frustration comes in.  I'm no noob when it comes to pc games.  Most of the games I've played require accuracy, speed, and precision in great amounts.  So I was naturally excited when I started learning the combat of this game, but I was soon disillusioned.  I would describe the combat as overall clunky.  There is no such thing as intuitive, fluid movement here, unless you perfect certain very difficult patterns that exploit properties of certain skills: patterns that are easy to mess up.   I would repeat a combo over and over again and have it be performed sucessfully only about 50% of the time.  I did get quite good at it, but it was never fun.  I never felt like I was truly in control.

number of helpful: 25 of 39 people (64%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 4, 2014
												Probably not worth your time.If you like anime, some fan-service, sidescrollers, and grinding you'll be fine.The Elwiki[www.elwiki.net] is a great resource if you're going to play.I've been playing on and off for a long time.The game makes a ridiculous effort to cockblock my attempts at progress. There's a stamina bar that limits how many monsters that can be killed in a day (it's manageable, especially with unlimited stamina weekends), but more importantly the EXP rates screw you over around level 45. I've been forced to grind several times in between dungeons around Velder for that reason, and it appears at the same spots on every character.The progression itself doesn't feel very spectacular. You only get a skill every five levels which isn't too often when the cap is 70. Once you finally do get a variety of skills, you're locked to only using four at a time unless you pay $10 for an expansion. Changing jobs is what pathes the way to more skills, but it also gives you new combos to use in addition to your character's base ones. The problem here is that most of these combos can be impractical to use, so having more than one of a character can feel incredibly repetitive.You mostly play the game by using combos. You also have to practice catching opponents in PvP and knocking them down wastes a good opportunity. Knocking down monsters reduces the damage they take and they may retaliate with a strong attack. Combos are pretty easy to do in PvE, especially since you can just obliterate the first 20 dungeons without a care. btw don't solo. Love yourself (and your stamina). Monsters tend to be more aggravating than they are challenging.The art is pretty and the outfits have a unique style, but the characters have been driven to almost exclusively fan-service. This is most apparent in the recent customization options (cash only) that have appeared in the Korean server. Most (if not all) of the new female art is sexualized.There haven't been many efforts to upgrade the "anime" quality to the game. They've stuck to the same assets they've had since the beginning which is ironic when I see ads saying "Play your manga!" as if that were the main appeal.The characters weren't amazingly unique but they had their own things going for them. Effort has clearly dropped in development, however, and this is most apparent in their most recently released character, Add, a blatant ripoff of Accelerator from A Certain Magical Index. Although it makes sense to try to appeal to anime fans in this way, it exhibits the disrespect the game has for its own storyline. The character preceding was an imitation from their previous game--a callback and a bit of respectable fanservice--so it was no foul, but, to be fair, it also wasn't the pinnacle of creativity.The worst part is I'm going to keep playing.

Posted: February 20, 2016
												 This game is the very worst possible evolution of the Free to Play model. Hotbars locked behind a paywall, bag slots locked behind a paywall. Anything resembling the art style of the game in  a set of armor, paywall. And these aren't tiny 1 dollar or 2 dollar paywalls, this crap is like 30 dollars at the least! Some things can be unlocked for 5 or 6 dollars, but each item is priced just high enough to send you up to the next 10 dollar incriment of the in game currency! Everyone in the game is decked out in high end outfits and you look like you are a character from another friggin game when your free clothes expire. Oh yeah, you pay 30 bucks for an outfit and it has a licence that expires most fo the time if you don't pay double for it! Don't get me started on premium emotes, stances and PVP gear. All around this game would be a blast if there wasn't a pay wall jammed into every nook and cranny of the game to the point it becomes totally unplayable. I would gladly throw a dollar on an outfit, maybe 5, but this pay model is off the charts ludicrous!

content:
Posted: March 17, 2015
												While i like this game, due to the fact i have freinds who play it and are willing to help me out, i just cant recommend it, this game pretty much takes everything bad about f2p, multiplies it by 10 and stuffs it in your mouth. lets see: grinding? yep. pay to win? yep. unbalanced characters? yep. this is scratching the surface of how bad this game is.1. depending on which character you pick everything will either be way to easy or near impossible. no in between. due to new characters being more and more OP with every release. take time tracer for example, he has a passive ability which allows him to shorten ability cooldown times, and has another "ability" of sorts which (from what i read) allows his MP and DP to top each other up, which sounds good, but that would desroy anyone in pvp2. levelling is ****, getting to level 15 can be done in about 5 hours, once you are about lv 50 it can take up to a week to level up again and with the stamina bar, you can only do about 20 dungeons a day, and quests can make you do a single dungeon up to four times AND some quests requre a certain level to complete them meaning it will take you about a month to complete a town/village (maybe half a year max for hamel and sander)3. the cash shop. oh god, dont even get me started. this abomonation is so unbalanced its almost laughable. not only are the purchasable things WAAAAY over-powered they are also often expensive as ****.costumes: between $25-$40 dollars for a full set (will give you IMMENSE buffs for pvp) pets: $4 seems cheap right? no. they start as babies and each time they get in to "special" stage you have to give them particular food which you have to also buy for about $5 for 10 which will get you to about teen stage (halfway) AND they are also stupidly OP, doing about 200% of your default damage in a single attack.skill notes (will make skills way more powerful): about $1.50 a pop and you can use six at onceneed more inventory space? $2 per tab, and whats worse, you start with about 3 rows of inventory space (9 slots each) and ONE backpack expander gives you: full space? no. 5 lines? no. 2 lines? also no. you get ONE extra line of space, meaning for full tab space (6 lines plus the 3 you get when starting) means $12 per tab and there are about 6 tabs (excluding costumes) means $72 for a full inventorywant to use more than four skills at a time? $9want more potion space? $6want a weapon that is more powerful without the risk of destroying it forever? up to $50 PER EQUIPMENTbasically that is around $100-$200 PER CHARACTER! i think that is enough on the cash shop4. pvp: dear holy mother of god. this is by far the worst thing about this game. if you enter you have to beg to god that your opponent hasnt spent money on the game, if so, you're ****ed. you might as well quit now.5. fossil readers and ice burners:(fossil readers can give you pets and mounts, ice burners can give you costume peices) they are $5 each. and while the items you use them on are relatavly common there is only a VERY rare chance you will get anything of use, meaning you may have to spend around $100 MORE just on these and with ice burners you also have to worry about character specific costumes. imgaine it like this: you spend $50 on ice burners hoping to god you get a costume and finally, on your 20th burner you finally get a peice OMFG I GURT A PEESE!!! and then you see it is for a different character. that means you have a 1:7 chance (that decreases with every character released) on top of the fact there is about a 1:100 chance of getting one in the first place6. dungeons: they are far too easy to the point that most of the time you can solo a dungeon 5 levels ahead of your level and the bosses are generic health bar bosses, bearly any variation, and if there is variation it is ofthen done terribly. super sheild, for example, means the bosses are close to invincible until you do something else (kill lesser enemies, beat the **** out of a "generator", so forth)it isnt all bad though, such as, the graphics are decent and the cutscenes they have recently added look great but the pros are far outweighed by the cons anyway unless you have a freind willing to help/give you stuff/give you their life savings, I have to say, avoid this game at all costs! it may look good graphics wise and the trailers are awesome but just about everything else is broken or ****. and sorry for any misspeled words. oh, and if you want a good f2p game look at tf2, robocraft or airmech, i have to say those games are the oppisite end of the spectrum for f2p games, ill post a reveiw for them soon

content:
Posted: May 9, 2016
Product received for free
												Back when this game was young, I'd say the characters were more fun to play. (Actually required a brain) Now? So many people are playing the characters that don't. This game (PvP wise) is more class focused. The classes that are pretty much easy and dumb to play are Add (DE and LP) , Ara, Elesis (GM mostly), Chung (IP), Lu/Ciel, and Eve. Although, Eve damage is more balanced in sparring. She's legitimately dumb in arena. So if you want to win A LOT, play a character that doesn't require a brain or minimum work. If you were to put the best LK vs the best DE player, LK would lose. Too many people play easy classes. What's the fun in that? It's horrible for those that plays a character that require more thinking and game plan. If this game were to make the old character more powerful to withstand those easy classes, it would be a lot more fun. The gear in this game are fine. Yes, even with +12, and +11. It's purely based on your class and how good you are with them. But if you're playing a class that requires more thinking, no matter how geared and skilled you are, you will lose to the easy class that is geared and skilled too. Not to mention that this game requires Player to Player connection. This means that if you live in Australia, fighting a player that's in the U.S, you both will experience delay. Some classes are more lag proof than other classes, so you may be at a disadvantage. Surprising Fact: Not a lot of people know about this. You would have to PvP on a class that's hard to play to understand this. (Class vs Class case) P.S I'm a CBT player and a KR player.

content:
Posted: July 7, 2015
												I honestly have nothing good to say about this game. - Gameplay, which is supposed to be focused on Combos, feels incredibly lacking. Don't expect anything more demanding than Z+Z+Z+Z+X.- Graphics. Full 3D should be a good thing, right? Nope. Especially when you see the same low-poly 'Bob The Builder' blocks being copy-pasted from dungeon to dungeon. - Deisign. Outfits should be an incredibly tempting 'must-buy' because of how good they look. In Elsword, most outfits consist of White, Black, and an 'Accent'. Or worse: PlayBunny, Demon, Angel, Oriental. - Sounds. I had to turn this off. Battle should consist of the sound of metal colliding and wood breaking...not whoopie cushions being let loose in a vat of butter. - Music. I certainly don't remember any of it, so I went on Youtube and listened to the tracks. None of them have a 'wow' factor...and they almost feel copy-pasted. - PvE. Pretty boring and really to easy to max out. There really isn't that much challenge out there. As I typed this, I even forgot it was playing in the background...wow.- PvP. Hope you spent money if you actually want to win. With regenerating MP, talent can only get you through so much before you end up stun locked or one shotted. Especially when LuCiel gets their 2nd job...- World HUB. This really bothers me because it feels like they're just trying to stretch out the gameplay as well as give you some reason to purchase a Mount. A Mount in a sidescroller. Think about it: $. You can also spend $ traveling from HUB to HUB. Even more bothersome, the World Map is accessible anywhere...so why aren't the two of them tied together instead of being weird seperate entitites?Honestly, Grand Chase S2 was as good as this genre was going to get. Elsword is your typical Korean MMO: No originality, hand holding grind, and a constant squeeze for cash and ideas from the community. If you go into Elsword and find yourself thinking that this experiance could be better, then go hunt down a Grand Chase private server. FGC. Obviously, I'm bitter because KOG failed to improve upon Grand Chase because they wanted to focus on Elsword.

												No doubt about it, Elsword is an amazing game with great gameplay and combat. I won't deny that, but what I absolutely hate about this game is the community.I'm an Elsword "veteran." I've been playing since before Eve's character release. I can tell you that Elsword had an amazing community with lovable players. It was very easy to make friends and get into guilds. It was like we were a big family. Even if there were tons of us.I'm not here to tell you how I miss the old Elsword. I'm warning you about this game. The community is absolutely horrible. I can't Arena without people whispering me "You have no skill." or "Salty?"It's absolutely depressing. I can't play this game without getting mad and taking it out on players, which only gets worse. Call me salty, that word's overused anyways.I hate Elsword. There was a time when I would recommend this game to you because it was amazing, but that time is long-gone and likely to never return.I don't want to sound like the "Haha, I've been playing since ____, and this game suCKS! I WANT THE OLD ELSWORD BACK!" because I, personally, don't like people like that and to be honest, they taint the "Elsword Veteran" name.We get it, the game was good back then but stop trying to get it back.That's why I'm quitting this game for good. I've never played such a rage-inducing game. Even Dungeons suck. I can't go through one without the entire team yelling "hurry up" just because I'm not at the portal within 1 second of the timer coming up.To be honest, it could just be who I am. Maybe I just have a low temper and all of the idiots are getting to me. You can try the game out yourself, nobody's stopping you. I'm just saying, be warned, the community isn't so lovable.

content:
Posted: January 9
												Elsword is a fun free-to-play game. You can play as many different characters with many different styles and the whole experience is multi-faceted and allows for a lot of varied gameplay. Upsides: lots of different characters with multiple different styles (except the newest character although I'm sure that will be changing soon enough), lots of different quests, both main and side, and the dungeons are varied and provide a challenge every now and then. Good for casual gamers. Downsides: in-game purchases alter the flow of the game quite a bit, PvP is kinda broken unless you spend a ridiculous amount of time or money breaching the gap, the story line exists but doesn't draw you in at all, guilds are a dice roll in terms of being helpful, multiple mechanics are not explained and require multiple google searches or maintenance requests from their main site for help, and servers have a tendency to be less than reliable.Side note: if you want spend money on their free-mium stuff, it's a tedious process of updating your account on their website *not on Steam* to even buy anything. Another personal gripe of mine is that the in-game costumes (that look really cool btw) are almost always temporary. When you buy them in-game they cost double to keep them permanently, which is just annoying in my opinion. Like, I'm already spending money on your free game, I would appreciate a little bang for my buck, ya know? Sorry, rant over.My downsides list is longer than my upsides list but that's because I have spent a lot of time figuring it out and want you the reader to know what to expect. But honestly, I enjoy the game and I'm being nitpicky because it had a lot to offer. If you like RPG's then you'll like this game. I have put more than 100 hours into this game and still enjoy it but that's honestly the minimum you need to get somewhere productive in the game. It's a good game for a casual gamer looking to kill some time when you want a break from other things or simply a long term grind.

content:
Posted: July 31, 2016
												Elsword....if I had to describe the game in one word to represent the game itself and its community I would have to choose the word....SALT. I wish I could get my money back and note that I'm asking to get my money back from a FREE TO PLAY GAME. That game is a penny pincher and is way too savage for a new player that has no financial support to get a good headstart on the game. Even many of the BARE NECESSITIES of the game require paying up to obtain it's not even a matter of obtaining them through more painstaking means. It's purely impossible to get far in the game without paying up unless you spend a full year of suffering on the game and have the luck of every single god from smite. The gameplay isnt even bad but it's very VERY repetitive. The game is too grindy and doesn't pay out enough for all the effort put in. Getting on to the events of the game I find that they are good SOMETIMES but usually the events require paying up for something in the item mall to even benefit from them. The next thing is the cosmetics factor which is OVERLY emphisized in the game or rather due to the community the cosmetic value in the game drains your wallet more than actually playing it. For a free to play game elsword is the most overpriced game I've ever encountered. You could literally use the same amount of money it takes to get 1 full costume set on elsword to buy any 30 dollar game that you could want. Hell I bet most of the people that play elsword could have probably had cars and 4K TVs and a LIFE if they weren't spending it all on chibi korean pixels. The final and most nerve wracking and stressful part of the game is its pvp. MY GOD. Those are the first words that come to mind when looking at the salt seeping out of arena. Arena is already unbalanced because of elswords favoritism of female characters. Due to this things like ROSE were allowed to happen....elsword couldn't even make their OWN CHARACTER for that one. Guess they ran out of trollish ideas and yoinked one from DFO. Rose please....go back home... PvP is already unbalanced as is but by allowing people to bring in +11-12 lvl 85 4D Gear with Raid weapons you only mean to add fire to the flame. I believe that last point on pvp speaks enough for itself for any of those who read this and fight the good fight.

												It's an enjoyable game, it really is, but I have to hate on the fact that this game is very 'Pay to Win'. You have to buy yourself the upgraded job/class for 2USD, (which in reality really is not much),  you also get some nice items for doing it, but those items last ~10 days, which ticks me off. If I was allowed to keep those items I'd be happier, but alas, I cannot. It is quite grindy, but what MMORPG isn't? All in all, I recommend it if you have a few bucks in your wallet and you're willing to spend it for a 10-ish day bonus costume and some extra skills, even without the job advancement the game can be fun, but sadly as it is highly P2W I cannot recommend it. If you're going to win me over, the least you could do is let me keep those job advancement items, like c'mon.Note: I have not played very long, nor have I tried the PvP.

												Wanted to try out this game for fun since I lost motivation playing Tree of Saviour.You can't play the game without having your account activated, but their automatic email system is ridiculously slow so I didn't bother until the next day. I found the input unresponsive when trying to perform basic beginner combo on both my keyboard and mouse. I had to spam my keys as if I'm trying to compete with turbo mode. Sadly this is with a latency of ~72ms with their server.Gamepad is not natively supported despite it advertise as having gamepad support on their site (so you will require third party software such as xpadder, joymotion, logitech gaming software, etc.). They lock you out of their official forum unless you spend money on the game. I can understand that if their community is extremely toxic, but you can't even view the forums as a newcomer who will not spend money on a game that you have not played.There's a few other problems, but overall, my first time experience was pretty disappointing.

												Elsword is an MMO that, obviously, has pay to win factors in it, but aren't needed. They are very helpful though. I have spent money but that's for  a e s t h e t i c s. 												As much as I want to recommend this game, as much as I did enjoy playing it before I hit the grinding threshold for purely F2P players aroud lvl 40, hell, as much as I enjoyed the PvP in the brief moments it felt functional, I cannot recommend this game because of the sheer amount of problems it hasIts F2P model is garbage, the PvP balancing, if you can even call it that, is some of the worst violations of common sense I've ever seen (Who would put high damage homing projectiles in a game without a block mechanic? KOG!), and the collision detection is wonky as all hell. (Just look at TyroneSama's "HITBOXES" series on Youtube) Also, lag manifests in interesting ways in PvP, ranging from warping all over the arena to walking out of combos to just being frozen in place to NOT EVEN FLINCHING. Overall, solid game ruined by P2W and poor balancing.

number of helpful: 7 of 9 people (78%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 11, 2016
Balance:    This game is highly unbalanced.  Just recently the NA servers went into the "renewals" which essentialy took away many of the fun skills as well as buffing certain classes to insane ends *cough* every rena class *cough*.  Every character has its own playstyle, and each class can vary that playstyle vastly.  However, it goes without saying that some characters will always be better than others, no matter how skillful you are.  However, this game is fun even if you do not main one of the better classes.  PvP is still winnable and PvE is nowhere near impossible.Fun or Boring:   This game is an MMO, so expect grinding.  However, expect much less grinding than any other MMO.  Leveling is easy, especially considering the exp boosts that KoG is always giving along with free level boosts.  HOWEVER, do not level boost your first character.  Leveling up your first character for the first time can be one of the most fun things about this game.  I am a PvE player and have yet to get bored after my countless hours.  I have logged in 832.5 hours on steam as I write this review, but have been playing since May of 2013.  Counting the hours I have before this game was on steam, I have quite a bit.  The game is still being updated constantly.  Events are nonstop, and new areas and level cap increases have been chaning a lot recently.  The best part is, you can check the KR server for things to come in NA.Community:   This is really a tough one.  Given it is an anime game, except creeps as well as normal gamers.  There are plenty of young kids who assume that playing a girl character means you are a girl irl... and will hit on you.  Toy with them :)  .  Besides them, there are random roleplayers and such, but finding the right guild isn't hard.  Many of the more active players will be in guilds that may not accept low levels, so finding good friends can be hard at first.Way the Game Plays:   Image super mario smash brothers, except with spells, mana, and an amazing PvE system.  Also, this game is much more respsonsive to controls given it is a PC game.  Lag can be an annoying issue, as a party cannot kick a lagger.  The only kicking system atm is one that allows all party members to vote to kick a player who hasnt dealt enough damage.  Even buffers do enough damage, so if the button is lit, I suggest clicking it.F2P:   This is a F2P game which means MANY MANY microtransactions.  If you want to complain that this game has too many or that its game breaking, please cry elsewhere.  Costumes are the only essential thing in this game that you can buy from the item mall.  However, you can get yourself 4 costume pieces for 250mil ED if you dont mind your costume not matching.  250mil sounds like a ton at first, but given you earn over 1mil ED per level 70 run, and there are now lvl 80 dungeons, you can earn that ED fairly easily.  Whats that? 250 runs just for costume pieces sounds like a grind?  Fear not.  As you level up, just make sure to hold onto your ED and you will have plenty.  I am not even including items such as secret dungeon materials.  You can obtain somewhere between 3-25 of these per run depending if you do lutos mode or not.  Currently these prices went up to roughly 300k-400k per piece, so you can sell those easily.  Not to mention, almost every event has free accessories or costumes that you can earn by simply playing enough (usually involves logging in for 10 minutes each day).  PvP is limited by your gear, but PvE is not at all.  I know someone who is ranked top 50 with a +9 weapon, which is now extremely easy to get if you understand the concepts of making money in this game.

content:
Posted: July 18, 2014
												To start off, you have to almost buy everything in the game including skill slots, and you only get 4 before paying. you also have to buy backpack expansions, which i can see reasonable, but the problem is they give you crap before buying expansions.Buying things with in game money are basically pointless except for  a variety of accessories, because by the time you get up to the level where you can use the weapon you can buy, you don't even need to buy it anymore.There are 2 upsides to this game though, the combat, and the characters. The combat is a hack and slash button mashing of z & x. Although, over a long period of time, the combat starts getting boring, knowing the only time you get more combat moves is when you get your class change, I am going to rate the combat a 6/10.    Each character has  their own story, weapons, and combat style, but some of the different characters have the same class change stats, which imo, is kinda lame, but like i said, they all have their own combat style.The maps in the game start to get redundant and lack imagination, because some of their maps are the same, but flipped, or with a different climate and time.I think the thing I hate most about this game is the stamina, you have stamina on every character, and when its empty, you can't do any dungeon quests and you have to wait until 3:00am to play again, which makes you think that the creators don't want you to play the game. My rating for this game is a 6/10. I do reccomend to people who are new to PC gaming. Its still fun at time and i would continue playing it because they are always adding new items and characters that get enjoyable.

content:
Posted: February 9, 2016
												I've been playing Elsword for a long time, even before it released in North America, since 2010. I even played the Chinese knock off Fists of Fu, or East Fantasy Online. I wouldn't be exaggerating if I said I had well over 20,000 hours. From 2010 to early 2014 this game was my life. And thankfully I kicked this bad habit of a game and haven't played it since 2014. Yet somehow this game is still on my mind, it's just a scar on my life I can't seem to forget. Avoid this game like the plague if you're weak willed like I was, it will suck you in and turn you into a salty ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ with an empty wallet. Pros-In it's prime it had some of the best PvP I've ever ever seen. I've still yet to find a game with a comparable combination of ultra quick cancels and combos. Cons-One of the most vile communities I've ever seen. Especially horrible if you're not a fan of Weeaboos."Events" consist of either PvP with a GM which isn't nearly as fun as it may sound, or an opportunity to drop $100 on costumes. Terrible netcode, in a game that requires such precise movements this is unnaceptable. It's also peer to peer, and they've merged servers before, so expect ping in the 100s quite frequently. Recently Reduced FPS cap, speed is tied to framerate in this game. With the 60FPS cap movement isn't nearly as quick as it was before, some combos can't even be pulled off anymore. It almost seems as if KOG is progressivly modifiying the game to make combat worse,As pay to win as you can possibly get. Not only will paying players have double your stats, but they'll have a total of eight skills to use, while a non-paying player is stuck with four. Completely Unbalenced,Old classes are completely outdated, (Wind Sneaker being the exception, her concept alone has been broken since she was released years ago) they recently released a character that literally replaces Elsword himself. Leveling up consists of doing the same dungeon 3 times or more. A casual player will probably take an entire year or more to reach the level cap because of this. The PvE is so painfully repetitive that you'll most likely be happy with any alternative you can find. chatting or roleplaying with weeaboos in the vile section of the game called "sparring" is usually what most end up doing.In my opinion the only reason this game is still alive is because a small group of unlucky people who enjoy collecting Ice Burner Sets. Ice Burner sets contribute to the pay to win aspect of this game, you spend $1 on an Ice Burner, this Ice Burner has like an incredibly low chance to give you a single piece of a costume set that changes on monthly basis. These costumes don't replace your armor, so the incredibly high stats on them after socketing give quite an obnoxious advantage over those who don't have them. These collectors often buy in bulk, usually $300 at a time, I've been playing long enough to not only see others do this, but actually do it myself. Less fortunate people look at collectors like gods. Hoping that their $5 charge will get them something (It wont). If you have a low spec PC, steam has so many better options than this terrible game. Do yourself a big favor and forget this one exists. The PVP videos on YouTube might seem really attractive, but it's really not worth trying.

number of helpful: 38 of 70 people (54%) found this review helpful4 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 29, 2014
												I played this game since the release of grand archer and wind sneeker.Where to start, the game can claim it's different than most game that are around today, which is true, not many do the gameplay that elsword does. Now where this game falls apart on you........some may tell you that leveling up is easy in this game, that's not true, it's only easy if you are below level 30 or so, after that you will have to repeat the same dungeons over and over and over and over and over until you run out of stamina, and which you find yourself having to not even level up ONCE and then you will have to repeat the process again the next day.EXP boosting does exist, but there is a catch, you either grind for a few days to get certain items to get exp boosting items, which will take a while, or you can just buy it with real money, which for the people with no means of getting real money or using them for an online game, that is really unfair. Why you would need to boost exp to level up only once and which still takes a long time to do is beyond me.You won't fully enjoy the game unless you're within the level range of 50-70, which again, why would I need to be that high of a level to enjoy a game to its fullest. I'm not just talking about certain things being blocked off to you if you do not reach level requirement by the way.Even so though, I'm not sure your attention span will even want to go that high of a level if you're not into grind fest, which this game is a HUGE grind fest. Example, early in the game, it will only take you around 2-4 hours to get from level 1 to level 15 easily, at first you're like, "This isn't too hard if the game is like this all the time." which you would be right......if the game worked like that in the first place...but when comes the time of around let's say....level 36, it will take you a day to jump to level 37.Now, let's talk about classes, the system is a complete mess, I won't lie to you. After you fight a couple of matches with people in your skill range ( as in how well they fight etc etc) you wll notice that some characters are WAY better in pvp than others. What do I mean by that, well....if you took an average skilled elsword and throw them against an average skilled add, more than likely without fail, the add is going to win. Why? well because all skills activate instantaneously, elsword is melee based even if he took the magic path, his range does not exceed that of an add's, the add player will only have to keep his distance and hit the elsword at least once to get even closer to him and then throw in some long comboes which will probably do a significant amount of damage, rinse and repeat. The same can be said about the mage, all she would have to do to beat a swsordsman, is run away with her teleport skill which has a low cooldown of about like 5-10 seconds, cast a spell (which is also instantaneous) run away, stand still to recover MP at which they recover MP way faster than any swordsman will recover, rinse and repeat.This doesn't only apply to PvP, those same characters that are generally better in pvp, are sometimes generally better in dungeons. WHY?! This baffles me on why this game only focuses on making the strong characters stronger, and the weaker ones even weaker, I just don't get it.Instead of making the main character, Elsword, which this game is named after him, stand a chance against these over-powered characters, they make an entirely different character, his older sister, the swordsman that can stand a chance against them. Any new character this game will add, you'd win any bet that that the new character will be even more over-powered than the last character. This game's balance of equal powers, doesn't exist, it's been throw out and left somewhere in the middle of nowhere.What's even worse for any elsword player is not what lies with the character himself, it's the community. Elsword has a skill which can make him unflinchable for only a few seconds so he can get past all these spells or long range attacks that are being thrown at him so he can stand a chance against them. Sounds cool right? Well, too bad, according to the community that skill makes you a noob and you will not be liked by anyone if you use it, and therefore discouraged to use it to give any elsword player an advantage over the newer characters and classes.I only list the character, elsword's, problems because he has it the worst, the second swordsman, Raven, may also have problems with these new classes and characters but not as bad as any elsword player.--------------------------This isn't the end of this game's problems, there is more..........-------------------------------------The community of people here isn't very pleasant.......You either have ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s who usually are the competitive type who aren't nice to you if you use a tactic that they don't like, or the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s who are just ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s because of no reason, people who are generally good people, or people who goes both ways. Some people you find you may say they are ok people, being ok people does not mean they are generally good people, just for the record. I will not hate on the beggars which I will talk about why later.Lag isn't something to write about because any MMO that has the same feel of fast pace fighting will face this problem. The lag will depend on how powerful your computer is and also your internet connection, so at that point it's not the game's fault so don't ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t me.Another major point to bring out is that this game is WAY, WAY too benefitting on the Pay-To-Win area. You don't gain a small advantage if you buy a costume and enhance it, you will gain a HUGE advantage. Well what do I mean by that? Well....if you fight a person, and you both do not have a costume before, you both are in the same skill area, same characters and exact same class, and you fight and it's a close match and you win. Well, the same person comes back the next day, has a costume and has enhanced it with speed or power and challenges you again, more than likely, you're going to lose more almost all of the matches against that person, and more than likely it will not even be a close match, because of your lack of a costume.The only only way to obtain a costume is if you pay real money to get one, or by people selling costumes, which is ANOTHER major issue to this game.....You see, the reason why I don't mind beggars is because I know there is a good reason for it....the economy is a complete and utter trainwreck, there is just no going around it. Hyper inflation has hit this game real hard and continues to do so. Want one of the current costumes that is only obtain through ice burners and generally looks cool? well you're going to have to pay 600 million ED (in game currency) for a single piece of that costume......WHY?!?! ED isn't easy to get either for people who don't use real money for this game, you eitehr have to do weeks worth of grinding for around a 200 mil, and then hear that the item you wanted has inflated to an even higher price, so you're screwed. Simple cosmetic items are far more EXPENSIVE than the actual gear that matters.-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------The only reason why I would reccomend you to play this game as it is right now, is if:A) You have friends you can play with and you know you're not going to hate eventuallyB) You only live for the grinding in gamesC) Have money to waste onto this gameD) Dont mind the fact some other characters are generally better than the one you are going to pickE) Will never touch the ranking PvP modeF) Have patience with a gameG) Don't get angry at gamesThese are the only reasons why I would recommend this to you.Oh, and it's not, " Only one of these apply to me, I think I'm going to like this." no you need to have the qualities of at least 3 of those options to enjoy this.

number of helpful: 9 of 14 people (64%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 26, 2016
												At one point, I had fun with this game (as evidenced by my playtime). However, that changed, and at the same time, I also realized that Elsword just wasn't a good game. Now, it's been a long time since then, but I can't imagine the game's gotten any better, and there's a reason for that. For now, the review....The main problem with Elsword, in my opinion, is that the combat is very, very repetitive. Going through dungeons will comprise a large portion of your playtime, and those dungeons require minimal skill, as you can simply mash Z and kill everything. No skill, forethought or strategy required. Unfortunately, this also applies to many of the game's bosses-- the only difference is that you might have to jump over an attack or two.The second problem is the shameless cash grabs. When I was playing, I would occasionally get some sort of container with excellent items inside that could only be opened with a specific key-type item. Where would one find those items, you ask? Why, the cash shop, of course.Look, it's standard P2W crap. I don't think I really need to go into detail here.The third issue I took with Elsword, and the reason I don't think it'll ever improve, is that the game had a bad case of power creep. Every so often, a new character would be released, and those new characters were invariably better than all of the other ones. This was a complete disaster for the game's balance, as these new characters would dominate the PVP, and everybody else (Myself included; I played Rena, one of the game's oldest characters) suddenly had a very difficult time competing.To wrap things up, the PVE isn't interesting, and the PVP isn't balanced. Neither is particularly fun after a certain point. So, what's left? Please think about that before you play the game.

First of all, Steam version are originally block download restrition back in a day but now you can download it. Note that I live in Asia region country which it was blocked but it restritcion removed recently even the standalone version removed them 2 years ago. Genius. Secondly, if you happen to have an International account (ID, PH and IN) you can't link them. Okay, wtf? You guys allow players from these INT server to use NA sites for download, register and play INT server onto the same client. Are you telling me that I need to have NA account in order to play on this version?Lastly, this game can be so addictive but at some point, when you reach into higher level, things getting hard right? Well, it's normal in any other games but this game is pay2win game. Everything needs to be pay. This is the only game that ask you to pay for the additional skill slots. Additional skill slots needs to be pay? Yes. This game also offer you with some overpowered accessorries on their item mall. This game are extremely bad with their RNG (random number generator) stuff. Expecting that you can increase your equipment to the desire level you want w/out taking out your money? Never heard of it.There's still more I can say but I let you guys newcomer explore this game more deeper. If you don't want to waste your money, please back off from this game. If you want to see other players suffer with your throwing money skills, go ahead. I would not recommend this game if you seek for fun. There is no such thing as fun in this game except if you play with your friends and/or guildmates.

content:
Posted: October 12, 2016
												Where do I start... This game was great. I say "was" considering I haven't played for months, perhaps a year. The last time I played Elsword was during the final 3rd class release events and the time I decided that the community and structure of the game was at it's most unstable. Apparently I was wrong. I liked the game, I really did, but honestly, I feel the updates come way too fast to earn any event prizes. I admire their attempts at bringing old players back to the game, but the rewards don't feel like a "welcome back" gift and more of a"Come back and we'll give you things". In the old days, Elsword had a skill system where players could choose to equip any skill out of an entire tree, that includes the hyperactive. Since then they changed it approximately thrice now; in one version, the original tree was revamped so instead of dedication sp to the skill to level it up in bundles, you had to level them up one-by-one as well as there being a passive-skill tree seperated from the rest, second and third versions being the ones available today. Something that hasn't change was the pay-to-look-pretty-and-still-somehow-be-better-than-everybody-else system. Ah memories, when people who took pride in their wallet dumped it into the game to get absurd amounts of magic stones to attribute their equipment with top of the line perks. The PVP is always the same though, you end up fighting another player within your rank or level range and get completely overwhelmed because of their dexterity. To those who want to play this, don't play a PVP mode. The ranking and matchmaking system is as skewed as WarThunders'. PVE is as equally skewed, but with the players being on the same side. Since I began playing this game, I admire KoG for implimenting the individual item drop thing, but alot of the game is repetetive. Scroll right, scroll left, kill everything, move on. I used to feel alot of competetition playing in PVE like I felt in PVP because everybdyo went straight for the mobs and ythen moved on. Yada Yada Yada.tl;dr: I used to like this game when I started out, but as the game developed, it lost that special something that hooked me in the first place. PVP sucks, PVE sucks because everybody kills something before you do, it's repetitive, Everything in the Premim+Casual market is overpriced, the updates keep changing the game that it's hard to keep up. I don't recommend it for people thinking they want to return to the game, but I do recommend it for first time players, just don't PVP.

content:
Posted: April 15
												I've played 25 hours at the time of writing this review. My character just reached level 60.First of all, don't let the people saying this game is P2W stop you from trying it. Yes, it is SLIGHTLY p2w but only at the top tiers of PVP. Far as a casual PVE game goes, Elsword is just wonderful. The main thing people complain about is the costumes, but from what I can tell so far the buffs they give are not that significant. I've had no trouble finding good sets of equipment to dress up my character with. I even choose not to wear the promotional costumes because I think my character looks cooler with just equipment on. Since I'm only level 60 so far I haven't really delved into PVP. But I have been looking into how you can upgrade your equipment, what you can grind for, etc. I really like what I've seen, there is a nice variety of equipment, if you just do quests you'll never feel like you need to grind or like you need better gear. A lot of the time I find an awesome set of equipment, only to find another set with better stats a few minutes later that I am reluctant to equip because it doesn't look as cool. The best part is, the advanced sets of equipment have set bonuses. The game is very generous as far as f2p games go. There is a stamina system, so you can't run dungeons when your stamina runs out, but this resets every day, and if you get a group of players you will barely use any stamina in dungeons. You can easily get free stamina potions though through quests or exchanging hero coins for them. You can also grind a bit to get costumes for free. Quests give you boxes with whole sets of advanced equipment, with sweet set bonuses. You can craft healing items, and quests give plenty of them to you for free. You also get 10 resurrection stones per day, which are basically extra lives in case you die. You can buy more, but I've never used all 10 in a day, even when playing the hardest dungeons for my level, on the hardest difficulty, while undergeared, solo.The community seems to be very friendly, I was invited to a guild that offers me free stuff (which I don't take because I'm independent) and I always feel welcome in dungeon runs, even when I'm with veteran players who are a lot better than me. Higher level players have no problem steamrolling dungeons and bosses for you, in fact most of them just enjoy showing off their characters. The only negative thing I can say about the community is that I saw a bot one time advertising in a village. The story isn't that compelling in my opinion. I just skip through all the cut scenes at this point, I play this game for the game play. If you're the type of person who enjoys side scrolling action/combat, and customizing your character, you'll probably enjoy this game. It's free, fun, and simply gorgeous.

content:
Posted: August 8, 2016
												(Note this is a long rant about this game so I wrote a little summery about the game at the bottom of this review to save your time. If you like to see the quick summery of it just scroll to the bottom (I won’t blame you….this is long….no pun intended) if you want details on what I find bad about the game than continue ahead)________________________________________________________________________________Although steam says I have w.e many hours I have I’ve played this game way before it even got to steam and when the newest character was the 4th one (Raven) and all I can say is this game is terrible (in comparison to its older version). And it’s mainly due to stupid design choices starting withPvEMainly untouched by the f***ery that is until you get to the higher levels and the divines hand comes down with a smite of a difficulty spike with ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t enemies hitting with the forces of semi-trucks loaded with nukes and simply requires you to have a bunch of potions and people just to fight through one redundant dungeon to the next (btw the story is go here do it 3 times sometimes more to get a drop or some♥♥♥♥♥♥than move on to the next)PvP (The bulk of my argument cause PvE is just so boring to even talk about)Oh where do I begin....this blight on everything divine and holy is the main reason why I have issues with this game. And it starts with the claim that it’s a “Technical skill pvp" but that is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t and here’s why. let’s say you’re  lvl 21 just starting to get into the ring trying to get your bearings,First match:  you'll match up with someone around your level a nice balance gameSecond match:  another match that’s balance what’s wrong with this again?Third match: ♥♥♥♥ING LVL 80 now you'd think oh no big deal surely the game auto scales us to a similar level or something to keep everything equal? Well...Your ♥♥♥♥ing wrong that bastarad lvl 80 will be dealing 80 lvl damage while you’re doing your 21 level damage so you could be great at the game and be able to out play everything your opponent does but you better have the grace of a swan and the unpredictable movements of a f***ing alpaca cause the instant that lvl 80 gets you he will steam roll your♥♥♥♥♥in a single combo...sort of like a mouse fighting a person with a nuke launcher, sure the mouse can wiggle his way around get some bites in but the second that guy pulls that trigger you better have your last will and testament cause you won’t have enough time to type the “f*** you lvl noob!!!” in your spurt of rage. Now here’s another issue in pvp and that’s the damn lag, the pvp lag is so bad you can even tell when you’re going to have to deal with it simply wait in the pvp loading screen and if someone marinates on 30% for too long guess what you have a lagger to deal with. And the reason why this is so bad is that it breaks the fundamentals of the game which is to cause a person to flinch so you can lay down your punishment, but laggers will slip out of these combos and be able to attack you causing you to flinch and letting them to combo you instead, And after a little testing the lag isnt caused by your internet but it’s the game its self that causes it (note this applies to some). For example if I pvp with my friend whos a block or so down from me no problem if I hit him he flinches everything is alright but lord help me (Or by freyja boobs *just look them up on the wiki…seriously*) if I pvp with someone who’s not even in my f**king city cause from that point lag starts to set in and it’s not your fault the game doesn’t have any dedicated servers to individual zones so your fighting people worldwide which leads to delayed reactions messing up your combos or a person would use a move a good while ago (which didn’t execute cause you hit him) but will pop out of nowhere damaging you and allowing the f**kward to roam free like a b*tch I mean bird. Oh and while we’re on the topic about breaking the fundamentals of the game, SOME OF THESE CHARACTERS ARE DESIGNED TO BREAK THEM. There are characters who have moves that put them in a super armor state which prevents flinching or it’s there damn passive (I’m looking at the damn elboy family) in conclusion screw pvp in this game period.  it’s not fun to much of the time and even without the lag the laziness to not have the game scale me and my enemy  to a f**king common level will ruin games that you could have won had the game stop being a lazy azz.Pay to win?F**kYes"Oh only thing you can do is buy costumes that’s not pay to win" --the elsword loyalist to everyone"F**k off you cheeky ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥" – me to those loyalist who say the previous statement and here’s whyCostumes in the game will give your characters stats like extra health, attack speed stuff like that. The problem about that is they not only give you these stats which will offset the balance of pvp if the other person doesn’t have one of those costumes but these costumes can be thrown into anvil of f**kery  and upgraded even more. This completely causes the costumes to have more bs stat potential than anything you can get in game (watch someone try to defend that by saying how to brought it and they deserve the stat boost and blah blah blah “"F**k off you cheeky ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥" ) putting this into perspective the average person would have about 5 pieces of equipment (not including accessories) now these pay to win masters would have about 11 a costume for each of the 5 pieces and hair now that’s without the damn enhancement stones which adds even more disgusting boost to the costume making your more powerful than the average player (and let’s not forget about the set boost you get adding even moreeeeeeee stats). and before you ask no there is no way to have a permeant costume in game you do get a costume but don’t get attach to it cause it will expire in about 10 days unless you buy the ♥♥♥♥ing thing note I didn’t put accessories into the count so that’s even more to deal with._____________________Summery and Conclusion_________________________________________This game is just a mess from the PvE in late game to the PvP from the beginning, PvE is the definition of insanity doing the same♥♥♥♥♥♥over and over again for something different, PvP is worked against by the core of the game in total and by the way its design. And to top it off the game is boring (mainly due to the broken PvP and redundant PvE), the only reason I really play it is because of the characters which I personally like as there really interesting due to their different job changes (think of Pokémon but when it evolves you choose from 3 different evolutions or 4 for one of the characters) there different play styles always were fun and the combo system in the game is actually really fun to play around with although it does have a learning curve but after you learn it you can do some real fun combos. But I don’t think the reason why we play games is just for one thing and I honestly will not be dropping a dime for this game in anyway shape or form cause it hasn’t earned it and instead of buying things to customize my character ( ironic how the steam page says how you can customize them as much as you want which is a bull face lie cause you need real world money and will buy a set of clothes cause of the set boost it gives) and note I have several characters to waste several bundles of dollars of several different characters is disgusting and more of a cash ♥♥♥♥♥ than evolve was at launch. If you play this game play it for the characters and to see their abilities if you find something worthwhile in it enjoy it although I don’t think it will last you a very long time .
