												So I will try to not sugarcoat it - Like many games from Nexon Korea, this game require sooo much cash to play if you want to win at stuff like pvp and everything.. The costumes usually come in sets, which allow you to gain additional stats with more pieces of the outfit.. However, not all of the pieces might be appealing on your chosen character so you will probably end up mix and matching outfits to make your character more appealing.. I mean you you are trying to prettify your character to make it unique as compared to all of the other similar characters. But if looks don't matter go ahead and spend the money.. Unlike other Nexon Korea game, say maplestory, every equippable item has the option to buy permanent costume pieces, much in the way that Vindictus (Mabinogi Heroes) does, with the expirable version costing less based on duration.

												I recommend this game for several reasons.1) If you love to do combos in games you can figure out what combos are good for you.2) Also if you just want to play with friends and just play together you can dungeons in regions.3) If your a competive person you can do PVPs and use combos that are best for you.4) If you just want to play want to train with friends you can set up a lobby and just train with your friends in sparring.5) You also can create guilds and earn guild points to level up your guild and make your guild stronger.6) There are different characters you can choose from and each character has there own job class you can choose from. There are 3 job class you can choose for each character (Not including Ara Haan) and those job class enhances your abilities.7) Also there are events you can do and they can get you new equipment and help enhance some of your skills in your skill tree.

content:
Posted: August 11, 2014
												Before I had Steam about a year ago I started playing this game. At first the prostpect of "Living in my own Anime," was more than enough to get me to download and make an account. At first it was intresting, the story line was great, the attacks were decent, the graphics nice. I kinda got bored of it though (or busy, either one) and put it aside. When I found it on Steam (new laptop yay) I was greeted with memories of playing and having a lot of fun. So I downloaded it again, logged into my old account and started playing. It was not the game I remember. I was greeted with a lot of bugs and the servers were so crouded that every 2 minutes there was a lag spike. And no it's not cause I have a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ laptop, I actually have a very good one, better than most of my friends. The layout of the sites and the options was like they just threw everything together and it made my eyes hurt looking at it. I tried to push through and hope that maybe I would get the hang of it but to no avail. I would not recommend this to anyone unless they make everything cleaner and less frenzied. And switch controls to WASD. 3/10Characters:+Story:+Graphics:+Layout:-Controls:-Gameplay:-Multiplayer:-Overall Enjoyment:-

content:
Posted: November 15, 2014
												First off, this game is great. The combos are easy to pick up and are satisfying. However, it does fall flat in some area's outside of pvp. You will end up using the same combo's against the same enemies with name and pallot swaps with improvements to their stats instead of using new models. in pvp the matchmaking is terrible. it will pit lvl 10's against lvl 30's. even if you've been matchmade fairly it just comes down to who hits first.the gear does'nt feel like it makes a difference, and makes you look stupid. this is because the devs want you to pay microtransactions for in game special currency for the slightly less dumb looking costumes. no fast travel so you'll be walking EVERYWHERE. the dungeons are repetitive with again, pallot and texture swaps. i like the concept, but overall this game isnt worth your time. dont even bother.

												This game is okay. The problem with this game which is completley opposite with most MMO's is it gets WORSE THE LONGER YOU PLAY IT. Here's the entire game in a nutshell. 1.Clear a Dungeon 2.Clear Same Dungeon on Hard3.Clear Same Dungeon on Harder4.Kill Certain amount of creaters5.Progress a little.The game is fun in the start where it's all new but by the time i was lvl 28 i had seen every creature and every boss (they reuse the same boss for multiple levels) Instead of making a BAD MMO, I would reccommend a single player game that focuses on mechanics and less on buying cosmetics and repetitive gameplay. But as for me it just wasn't good.

content:
Posted: July 31, 2014
												Elsword is an amazing game to play with friends and family, game is pretty fast paced and has a more in depth combo system than it may seem with two basic attack keys and 4 or so active skill keys. But I do not reccomend this version... while it may say I've been playing the game for 53 hours, I should note I first started playing Elsword as far back as Closed Beta for NA.The problem with this version of Elsword is being it has slowly creeped from something you didn't need to cash to play, into something where it seems your credit card is becoming more and more of a vital tool to keep up, speccialy if you wish to remotely even buy anything in the market that's been inflated to a point any in-game ED(Gold) you get will only really be spent on NPC services.The host as well hasn't proved shy of converting free features into cash features. Skill Notes for example have been converted into a mostly cash feature, they improve skills you can learn in some way or another. But unelss you wish to get a skill note for a lousy active skill nobody chooses for very good reasons. Due to how the skill trees work in this game, you often won't even pick up the worse skill in a choice since picking Skill X will lock Skill Y entirely, making many if not all quest earned skill notes left unused. (If you plan to play the Korea version, this point is null as skill notes are a mob drop over there.)And then going back onto the economy... an in-game gamble box will give cash players many of what they'll need.. and more. So don't expect to be able to sell your rarer drops to them except for Secret Dungeon drops. This is because the gamble box gives them much more of the same items you can find in-game form mob drops... without the grind. This has resulted in an in-game economy where only cashers can trade with cashers and very few if any F2Ps can actually buy anything of note worth, the aforementioend skill notes bought with KC can be traded after being bought... but the ED to KC rate will make it far too much ingame gold for one out of 6 skill note slots..While I do enjoy the game itself as well... a game mechanics wise and as a fun arcadey co-op beat em' up, I have to advise players to stay away from Elsword NA. Look into other servers instead, I'ms ure if you google a bit you can discover many other servers of which may be a far superior alternative.

content:
Posted: September 20, 2014
												"steam must be running to play this awesome game."yeah, i have steam up. im writing this review right now. on steam.here are the pros and cons of this game:pros: an immersive storyline and world. i feel like im actually there, living the life of an ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ who is constantly clicking the play button, watching the same message pop up again and again, telling him that steam is already running, they just dont like him enough to let him actually play the game. i can almost feel his rage as if it were my own as he furiously writes a review of this game.cons:the graphics are sub-par; almost borderline non-existant. there are no sound effects or music, either, unless you count the sound of my heated, irregular breaths as i rip my own arm off and wildly beat my computer into submission with it. what i have just described is the only actual gameplay i have gotten out of this game. you can say its kind of like a "going to the doctor simulator" where i get fitted with a prosthetic arm and have a funeral arranged for my withered, lifeless appendage. i plant flowers next to its grave, courtesy of aeria games, who thought it to be only fitting for my arm to be buried with flowers sent by the very company who destroyed it. i typed this review with one hand. rest in pieces, righty.

content:
Posted: July 31, 2014
												Elsword is sort of like a 3D Maple Story in it's own way. So if you enjoyed that, you might like this.From the begining it can get qutie repititve really fast. It's not like most MMOs where you have an abundance of quests to do, rather, you only get a few quests per level. This can get pretty frustrating past level 40, as it forces you to either dungeon grind or field grind (Fields are areas with monsters that you can do repeat quests over and over. It's very stamina efficenet on weekdays, and gives a fair amount of xp.) Ereda Island is also a nice alternative if you're looking for PVE mixed with PVP. It's stamina efficent and it gives good exp.This game does have a stamina system. When you run out of stamina, you can no longer dungeon or gain exp from monsters in field. While most would be turned off by this, I personally don't find myself ever running out of stamina. This might be because I enjoy playing plenty of characters though, so I switch often. On weekends, stamina is unlimited. I can't really think of many things that are bad about Elsword, persay. Some would call it pay2win, due to the only way you can aquire costumes and such is through the cash shop. Plenty of players are able to play with no trouble and never spend a dime on the game. I have personally cashed, but I do remember what it was like not to cash as well. Not being able to cash limits some things, but I wouldn't say by much. You could also buy KC (The cash shop currency) from other players, but our economy is quite terrible right now so that may not be an option. Whether you cash or not does not limit your ability though, and those who think like that are silly. I think PVP is the one reason why I think this game is great. The combo system and how everything works together is very interesting. Unfortunately, many people are quite rude in PVP and those who are considered the top players have a large ego. Prepare for the salt if you decide to PVP. (I do not recommend PVPing before at LEAST 45 if you decide to, due to level differences. If you choose to PVP before then is at your own risk.)http://elwiki.net/ is a great place for game information if you're looking to have questions answered. You can always try the game's forums as well. People are usually kind there, just be careful on how you word things.

Though if your intrested, let me know!-Kuma)Oooh where to start. Well,it plays decently even though it uses arrow keys, some songs are great in the game, and the RP community are nice people. But trust me, the negatives Outwheigh the positives.The community,outside RP, Is TERIBBLE. JUST AWFUL. Sea salt levels of bad. They are so awful, there rude, they allways complain about everything, And dont get me started on the microphone chat. Essentially, its a all-channels chat that you have to buy microphones with currency that you have to buy to talk in it. Thats all you wanna know, trust me.The combat is broken, and dont get me started on PVP. Its so bad that for these past 2 years ive ONLY rped.Alot of the dungeons are not memorable, and not good music in alot. Although when they do music right, they do it RIGHT. The bosses arent very memorable either.The voice actors are..Mostly actually pretty decent. Mostly.Rose is proably the best character story&emotions wise, and with zero, shes pretty comical in cutscenes, but shes the absolute worst in fighting wise.Luciel is broken, and has the best backstory&chemestry with her partner, Lu. Keep in mind zero does not fight, unless in a skill, unlike LuCiel. I dont Spar/Arena/Dungeon anymore, so i cant tell you specifics on now shes broken, but trust me, she is.And its sorta free-to-pay? See, unless you have AMAZING armor, you cant stand a chance. You will have to spend months to get good armor.And finally, the actual story. Mcguffin magical energy called el is in everything and is kinda the ONLY DRIVING POINT OF THE VILLANS,theres fanservice..Each town has its own story, and most are okay. Although Elders is proably the weakest.And thats as not-spoilery as i can get, folks. Also demons because...Anime,i unno.BUT, all things considered, i give this game a 5.5/10. I stay because of the friends i made there,since ive been playing for years, i cant just abandon them. You can give it a shot, though it might not be your thing, or you could get♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥by the community,sparring,and the things i listed. I wish i could give a meh rating, but since i cant, Yes for now. (Also trandesence is way OP, Get it if you wanna stand a chance in spar. Because of this, i make my rating a No.)Note:Heres a little thing about Ain. I like him. Hes relatively okay, i like him as a character, i like how different his job classes make him, and i love how he fights. This wont change the score, but he is my faviorte character all around.

content:
Posted: July 28, 2013
												I was actually very surprised by this game. It was free so I decided to try it, and i have to say the gameplay was very pleasing. The artstyle was also a factor, it's not fancy, but it gives the world a very quaint charm that makes you want to come back.The different classes and the class evolution system is pretty solid, and each class branch certainly fills in it's own unique role. With six base classes and with 3 possible branches for each one, there is almost certainly a class suited to your style of play.The combo system isn't too hard to master, and stringing together hit after hit feels very satisfying. Each class's skills are also very diverse and different from another, adding a whole new level of gameplay to master with each class.In conclusion, I am very glad that i discovered this little gem of a game. It was very fun to play.The only drawbacks I can see is that after a while the game can feel kind of boring, and the art, while quaint, feels a bit too cute at times for my taste.

content:
Posted: January 24
												Absolutely unacceptable basic functionality failures.First, there is no way to access any options menu, so the game starts windowed in such a small resolution as to render text almost illegible, and you are forced to select character/class in this situation.Second, the game starts with no sound whatsoever. Third, you cannot access options to rectify either until the first "town". This was discovered through Internet searches.Fourth, the second enemy I came across stopped taking damage, and the game would not let me progress to said town.Finally, because I could not access any settings or menus because the game would not let me progress to the first town to do so, I had no way of exiting the game. The game doesn't have a dedicated program name in Task Manager, and the actual game process refused to close. Alt-F4 also failed to work. I had to look up how to exit the game, and the "solution" was to disable my NIC card until the game lost connection with the server and auto-terminated.Just... Holy crap, KOG, you failed on just about every level. Congratulations, not only do I not care if the game is enjoyable after all this, the basic functionality of your program was more akin to a malware popup. Just bloody awful.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 27, 2016
												I've played this game over a small handful of years and it's a game that one can have fun, but it can get really repetitive after a while. There is newer jobs throughout the times I've played the game, but they seem to throw a veil over the previous classes. (Do disregard the hours. I've played for a while mostly on the non-steam client.)= - = - = Positives = - = - =Fun with Friends:Honestly, this game can give several hours of banter and being idiots on the game. I can't normally play this game without others playing it, especially after a while of playing. Stamnia Bar:While this may limit progress, it does give you a good steady progress of leveling and not overdoing it. I've played games for 10+ hours in a row because stamnia bars weren't included or implemented and end up blowing my entire day on a game. There is ways around it with events or the cash shop, but you don't have to push it. You'll normally spend up to 3 to 4 hours, at most, straight with grinding before you'll run out.Consistent Events:This is the only thing that curttails the whole cash cow complex of this game. You need to cash in on these events, especially if they give out some lucrative items (like Stamnia Potions or Cash Shop Gear) throughout the duration. There is hardly any time where they don't have less than two events running at the same time.= - = - = Negatives = - = - =Cash Cow / Pay-2-Win Complex:This feature right here can kill a game, especially when it's tied into the game to hinder progress towards end game content. Sure, the clothes may seem nice, but they come with stats and without those--you'll be spending countless hours trying to get around it. This has been a problem for not a few months, but years actually with little-to-no resolution.  Alongside, some of the things in the shop, especially with the gear, Class Rebalancing Needed:Many of the newer classes would end up being the trend, especially when someone's been apart of the game for a while. Even if a nerf comes across, it takes many weeks to months before they actually resolve the overpowered class with a patch. I can't play some of my classes now, because they just fall off compared to newer classes.Consistent Repetitiveness:For the majority of the game, all you do is run into dungeons, kill things, and there you go. You can go out into the field and kill field bosses and trash mobs, but they don't give essential experience unlike what dungeons give you. This was a main killer of the game's attention towards me and end up quitting for weeks to months at an end.= - = - = Verdict = - = - =I have to get it a negative rating barely because this game has hardly ever kept my attention for more than a week. Don't get me wrong, this game is fun and all--yet, there's many mechanics in the game that either gets boring really quick or requires you to dump real-life cash to achieve end-game status. If you're a person that doesn't mind tossing some green around to get boosted into end-game, then by all means--go ahead. However, if you're a person that's barely making it paycheck-to-paycheck or don't have the money to toss around, then I highly don't recommend this game without putting limitations on purchasing things.

content:
Posted: September 20, 2013
												You need to play it yourself to see what it's all about, and when something is free, give me one excuse why you shouldn't at least give it a shot.A great MMO and a great Beat-em' Up merged into one neat title which can be a little heavy on your wallet at times but is still an overall great experience. At the time of writing I've put 100+ hours into 3 characters, and it was mostly worth it. A few frustrations keep this from being a 10/10 game but it's certainly worthy of at least an 8. Great combat mechanics, fun combos, good anime-style visuals, passable story. lots of variety and lots of fun and laughs. Highly recommend.

content:
Posted: April 5, 2015
												I like this game and all, but as most people say, it's P2W and certian characters in arena are stupidly OP, I will elaborate on this."It's a free to play game why would you spend money on it?"That's because you can buy certian equipment from the Cash Store that gives you boosts in stats. This gives people many advantages in PVP as people who are willing to pay can just wreck others who don't have the stat boosts from the in game purchases.Now, PVP.Before you do PVP you will want to learn combos as if you knock down your opponent you cannot damage them but here is the thing.There are certian classes (Wind Sneaker I'm looking at you) who can just spam the EXACT SAME THING OVER AND OVER. This means you are prone to massive damage while you just sit there, spamming all of your motion keys, trying to move the ♥♥♥♥ out of the way."But you can mana break to get out of it."Yes, you can mana break but that requires (you guessed it) mana to use and that is one of your most dependant source for tons of damage during PVP.Also the matching in PVP is stupid.Right now I'm a lv 52 Yama Raja, expecting a challenge in PVP.Nope.I get paired against lv 15 - 30 people.But, even though I get paired against them, there are certian classes that just dominate the arena, here are some examples:Crimson AvengerDiabolical Esper (and all of Add's classes for christ's sake he's just OP in general)AsuraWind SneakerDeadly ChaserIf you get stuck in one of their combos YOU ARE DEADJust mana break♥♥♥♥ YOUI will admit, I do enjoy this game to a certian extent, but it requires a LOT of grinding to get the best items.Did I mention how much you have to grind?You have to grind alot.For example, with Yama Raja's.You need to kill this one boss 4 times.And another one 3 times.And those stages are looooooooooooooooooong.Then, after that, you need to collect 100 drops from this group of monster."That isn't hard just kill 100 of them."They don't even drop 100% of the time...In short, this game is unbalanced in some aspects and you have to either:1. Grind to get good items2. Buy good itemsWhich one do you think is easier?

content:
Posted: March 16, 2014
												There's only really one thing to say about this game: It's very fast-paced. Unlike the automatic hack-and-slash of some side-scrolling MMORPG's, Elsword requires you to manually press the buttons and connect the attacks yourself. At the beginning, it might be boring and uneventful, but as you progress through the levels, the dungeons and the towns...you'll find that things do get a 'little' harder. And while you may have to grind more and more to get to the next level, it's worth it. WORTH. You know why? The PVP.The PVP in this damn game is phenomenal, and it's what hooked me into Elsword in the first place. Yes, it might seem easy in first glance, but experiencing it for yourself brings you to a whole new world. It's fresh. Exciting. Exhilarating. And most of all...it's addicting. ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, I'm not kidding when I say: Prepare your♥♥♥♥♥♥ here comes the butthurt-whenever you step into Arena 1v1 and 3v3, or sparring. It's not easy. Not at all. It's hard, and it will test you and keep pushing you beyond your limits. It pushed me beyond my limits. Consistently. Just when I thought I couldn't get any better, I did. It's so competitive yet strangely casual at the same time that it's surreal. Honestly, for me, the reason that I keep coming back to Elsword despite the grinding and the fact that things do get a little repetitive, is the PVP. So what are you waiting for? Download it now! Even if you might not like it, just keep it and PVP once in a while to feel adrenaline pumping throughout your veins. There's nothing like it.

content:
Posted: July 16, 2016
												TL;DR new players should at least give it a try, I highly recommend it. Just try not to stick to the game as a main hobby.Okay, so I'm a long time player and a pretty big spender on this game, and I have MUCH more unrecorded hours.This is the kind of game that you pick up and drop later on. If you're a new player this game is just divine, especially if you have friends to play with, all these classes are different from each other in so many ways ((Okay, maybe sides Elsword and Elesis, but they're related and do have some different mechanics)), and each class branches off into 3 other classes which in my opinion is very well done because it feels like you're playing a completely different character if you played the same one but a different class. It's fun to get into, the story is kinda below average and skippable but I enjoy the journey. The game has dialog, and voice acting in English and Korean which would be their native tongue ((So it's obviously sounds better)). Events come in bi-weekly mixing things up and there a total of 10 areas to explore and an upcoming 11th as I write this. Each area has a medium of...5 stages to fight in. The battle is fluid and amazing to watch, very flashy as you combo in skill after skill and it's just a blast to try out how each character works. So, the cons though...So it is a F2P MMO and like a lot of those, it is a p2w  kinda thing... Every character can put up 4 skills for battle, unless you purchase a skill slot for a good 9USD, which is kind of a lot? The other bad part is that it only applies to that character and if you want another you'll have to buy another. A lot of the players are unkind, if you move into higher levels and higher ranks in terms of pvp, a lot of people get very unhappy. It kind of gets to the point to where I mute chat when I pvp, not to mention that the people can be awfully cringy at times or even have a superiority issue. I'm speaking from experience here, it wasn't from just being there alone, it's all over the megaphone so you have to be there. The only characters people play are the ones that are powerful. There are a total of 11 characters with 3 classes each, but around 10/34 you'll actually see. (( One character has 4 classes))There are events in which sometimes only involve spending money. Like, a whole 2 weeks of waiting for the next event only to have be "Buy this cash item and you'll havea chance to have more than one!!!" But that's only on occasions. There's also broken english here and there, visual glitches, and you can attack through walls as long as your attack box is big enough so hiding is no option.I think I'll have to have pvp seperate here.Oh boy is this a mess. Once again I recommend turning chat off as you move to rank A and above which can be done by pressing TAB then clicking on the chat bubble. Any thing below rank A, the people are kind, and you may even make a few friends. The "balance" patches this game recieves that redoes everyone's skill is focused on pvp and each time it's usually a nerf no matter how hard it hits you in pve, the game usually hits you because this 1 character is killing everyone else easy. Lag is also an issue, I understand that people's internet may be faulty, but I can't help but feel that the game could be doing a lot better itself, there was also a change a few months back making the game max fps to reach for 80 instead of 60 which really doesn't help players with low quality internet. Though if you are lagging a lot in a match to the point it is unplayable, the game will automatically kick the player off the match and call it a win for the other person which is pretty fair in my opinion. Items! There's no way to turn these off in ranked arena. From time to time little items will appear giving the player who grabbed them an advantage be it health, stun, super armor, or even more mana plus a smaller hitbox. This can be pretty unfair considering some players can fly, teleport, or even have attack comboes that propel them making slower character have a disadantage. Yes, they can be faulty, and give debuffs instead, but going for items make it seem kind of unhonorable, and when you don't and they do and they grab an advantage, it just feels kinda bad which adds to the salt.If you need help with anything  and new to the game, just message me on steam and I'd be more than happy to help you in any way I can.

Posted: October 1, 2016
												Personally...I don't see what everyone's b**ching about...there's a very simple way to fix most of the "toxic community" problems that most of you seem to have...go solo...It's what I've done since the beginning...and I've been playing this since before it came to Steam...I was with this game before all the new characters started getting added in...Granted the community is not the BEST...but it's better than most...It's usually that there's always that ONE guy who loves to be an A-Hole...you can't do anything about that...I don't care how many people blast me for this review...I'm defending this game because of how good it is...All these fools saying it's Pay to Win...BULLSH!T...I've gotten THREE of my characters up to Level 50+...and I didn't spend a SINGLE CENT...I have great equipment for them too...and again, didn't spend any ACTUAL MONEY to get it...It's only P2W if you want it to be...if you want costumes and stuff...go ahead and waste your money...I don't need them, because I play alone...I've tried guilds...but it was just a waste of time...I recommend this game simply because this game is better than all these haters are saying... And I want to point out that even though it says I only have 31.4 hours on record for this game...my actual playtime for this game, including before it was on Steam...totals over 500 hours...SO YES, I KNOW WHAT I'M TALKING ABOUT!!!

Is it just me, or whenever I get into a match, HALF of the people I get have Time Warner and they start ♥♥♥♥ing teleporting like♥♥♥♥♥♥ they take an HOUR to flinch, and they freeze for like an eternity. If you have ♥♥♥♥♥♥ internet, please just do me and the rest of the Elsword players a favor by getting ATLEAST DECENT INTERNET. content:
Posted: July 26, 2014
												Elsword is indeed very repetative with many dungeons and quest that can often cause thge player to have frustraitions while playing the game. That however should be no reason to not try this game. Besides being repetative Elsword has plenty of features in game to make the game more fun and also entertaining. One Feature is character customization. The game has many In-Game shops where you can buy accessories and diffrent types of armor for your character. If thats not not enough the game also has a cash shop where you can buy many kinds of costumes  and items that give you mounts and many peices of gear that helps you make many diffrent character customizations. Another two features is pvp and the skill tree. Elsword has a solid base for pvp that allows you to create your own combinations of combos that can knock your opponent down with lightning ast attks to attking your enemy while their in the air with swift skills or slashes from the characters blade. with many skills and combinations to chose from the pvp has a uniqueness of its own. For players that want to get married in game there is a marriage system. The marriage sytem is broken into 4 steps. first you need to find the person you want your character to marry. afterwards you need to buy the couples ring from the cash shop (The item can only be found in the CashShop alone).once you give the ring to the person you want to marry you must wait 3 days (this time can be used to get to know eachother better ). when the time is up you can buy the marriage pakage which will have a certain number of invatations you can send to your friends and a item for using one of the chappels in the game. The final feature i'm going to be speaking of is the world aspect of the game since with all due respect i don't want to waste any more of peoples time.the world aspect may be that it is a side-scroller game but that doesn't mean it doesn't have anything for you to do. this multiplayer game will have you in a single player instance to start with in the beginning but there is more to it. after that one instance you are sent into the open world. you can meet many people, make friends, even for you people that struggle with the dungeons or quest there is a large community of people to help you get through the game.

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 24, 2014
												Here we are, yet another review on this game. I'm not gonna go so deep into things but I'll make this enough to know what's going on.Been playing this for 2 years before I joined Steam and it used to be a fun game, but went downhill ever since CBS was released. There's been less and less balance between the characters since then and it's nearing a breaking point. to avoid most of the headache, don't do PvP. You won't be able to get a few items by avoiding it, but it's all mainly for looks anyway.Dungeons to me are fine at first, but get really tedious after a while because it's the same tactic. Beat the crap out of everything as fast as possible, rinse, repeat. Very few bosses either need a strategy or force you to divert your attention. They have fixed the leveling issue a bit with the new random missions, but it's still a long grind in order to hit the level cap, which needs to be done if you wanna be as powerful as possible.Speaking of power, this game is free to play, but is so Cash Shop geared that you can put tons of money into it and become nearly unbeatable. There's also players that pride themselves on this stuff, so that's even more fun removed from the game and the reason why no one really does another thing called Ereda Island despite there being less hackers in the game.What I do like however is very little. I like how the game looks and some of the gameplay, but it's (again) overshadowed by the pay to win crap and lack of balance. The soundtrack isn't bad, but hearing it after a while, you may just mute it and get your own music. Most impressive looking places are the Hunting Fields and trust me, you'll see a lot of them given the grinding issue. I do like how the characters are designed too, along with the various looks you can give them even without putting a single cent into the game.So, what do I think overall? It's decent if you don't mind the grinding and don't play PvP. But it's gone downhill so much that this is mainly to kill time or play dress-up. You can make friends, but you WILL make enemies too given the community. And in game crap is expensive, but smart players can get around that. All in all, it's a good idea gone bad and I can't really recommend it. Trust me, there's a lot more negative things I can mention about this game that I didn't put in...

content:
Posted: June 20, 2015
												All these people whining about "paying to win" probably never stayed for the events that KoG keeps putting out, and why are people complaining about the unbalanced PvP when there is so much more to the game? No peripheral vision for these things whatsoever.Costumes and extra skill slots and maybe even some extra mana or anything for in-game benefit are all purchased at someone's own conscious decision, and to everyone bashing the game just because they can't get those things, you don't need them. KoG isn't innocent in this either, they're making all kinds of appealing cash items available to us, especially costumes and summons, but all of this is optional, and it does not make or break gameplay. The game itself is not "pay-to-win" at all, and while in PvP, rings and such give an advantage, but it's mostly skill that people develop as they play.Dungeon play is great with multiple players, and four skills usually do one enough, and people complaining about the B slot just want to have more skills to use, (when there are plenty of bread-and-butter combos and skills to use) and as I said earlier, events exist for just that. The past few events had quests that earned you a 15-day slot B medal, and it's hard to keep throwing jabs at the game after you realize how generous they're being.This is a very well developed game and it has a good team working on it still. They constantly put out new events and updates that keep the game fresh, and it makes for a broad range of things to do when you get tired of doing one thing. Basically, unless you play for 12 hours a day to grind experience points, the game will always be very fun every time you play.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 16, 2014
												There's only really one thing to say about this game: It's very fast-paced. Unlike the automatic hack-and-slash of some side-scrolling MMORPG's, Elsword requires you to manually press the buttons and connect the attacks yourself. At the beginning, it might be boring and uneventful, but as you progress through the levels, the dungeons and the towns...you'll find that things do get a 'little' harder. And while you may have to grind more and more to get to the next level, it's worth it. WORTH. You know why? The PVP.The PVP in this damn game is phenomenal, and it's what hooked me into Elsword in the first place. Yes, it might seem easy in first glance, but experiencing it for yourself brings you to a whole new world. It's fresh. Exciting. Exhilarating. And most of all...it's addicting. ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, I'm not kidding when I say: Prepare your♥♥♥♥♥♥ here comes the butthurt-whenever you step into Arena 1v1 and 3v3, or sparring. It's not easy. Not at all. It's hard, and it will test you and keep pushing you beyond your limits. It pushed me beyond my limits. Consistently. Just when I thought I couldn't get any better, I did. It's so competitive yet strangely casual at the same time that it's surreal. Honestly, for me, the reason that I keep coming back to Elsword despite the grinding and the fact that things do get a little repetitive, is the PVP. So what are you waiting for? Download it now! Even if you might not like it, just keep it and PVP once in a while to feel adrenaline pumping throughout your veins. There's nothing like it.

content:
Posted: July 19, 2014
												i've read that the communities of this game and grand chase arguning because they look similar. Because both characters have red headed swordsman, female elf archers, and purplehaired mages they have an excuse to scream at each other. but where the difference ends. STORY: The story is that a stone called the "El" were stolen by bandits and its up to the el search party to get it back. The story moves on to each village to move the story. The "El stone" story ends at altera when you finish the quest "Tunring everything back to normal." Then story goes to Feita with an demon invasion. The story ark reminds me of certain anime like fairy tail or naruto. 9.75/10CHARACTERS: There are currently 9 characters on both versions. what suprises me about them are that 3/9 characters included demons. Chung, Ara Haan, and Elesis. The character are Elsword, Rena, Aisha, Raven, Eve, Cung, Ara Haan, Elesis, and the insane Add. I like Add the most because of his backstory, gameplay, and personality (reminds me of lasercorm from smosh games). I feel mad for raven, chung, ara, and add. raven betrayed by his fellow soldiers, his fiance and friends died saving him and became a cyborg in the aftermath who u can fight in the first dungeon in altera. Chung's dad got possesed and almost died from severe injuries. ara family got slaughtered by demons and her brother became a demon (Final boss of hamel) and add family got killed (not by demons), sold in slavery and driven insane by isolation. The backstories suprises me with any way. (thank u south korea) 9.80/10GAMEPLAY: By comboing your enimies to oblivion through special/actives skills. When u reach level 15 you'll be able to choose multiple paths. 3 for elsword, rena, aisha, raven, eve, and chung. 2 for ara and elesis and currently 1 for add at the time. You will have to go through a quest line before advancing to the next class or you can spend 200 K-ching and you'll be able use new combos with the chosen class then advance to the 2nd job at level 35. either quest line or pay 400 K-ching you're pick. what i really love about elsword is he final dungeons. The final dungeons supply you EXP for you to level up and a challengin boss. There's a dungeon called henir's time and space which actually a boss rush mode. I've seen videos of player beating it with they're best time. There are also secret dungeons when u get to the level cap (70). However there is a stamina system which is spent on dungeons and hunting in the fields. when all of the stamina runs you can't dungeon untill 3:30 A.M. 9.5/10PVP: The match making..... is absolutley broken. my level 42 elsword is set with a max level elesis. you start playing PVP at level 10 its fine at that lower levels then gone to hell later. 0.01/10COMMUNITY: The only was chatting with other players is either in a guild or in the sparring rooms. 7.89/10CASH SHOP: i can't get enough with the cash shop. costumes. check. quick slot extensions. check. pet adn mounts. check. Inventory expansion. CHECK! 10/10FINAL VERDICT: I love this gams with a passion. I have over 500 hours in to this game and my highest level is a add. combo monsters to oblivion. The gamplay is good. Pvp is below average. The stamina can get annoying but who cares. 9.99/10

Posted: September 18, 2014
												Now this is overall a mixed review of Elsword, as it has its pros cons. I'd like the start with the cons as in my opinion, the cons should come first, (I apologize if this review isn't all that great, it's my first one haha). Okay so where to begin...The community is pretty ♥♥♥♥♥♥ the way I've experienced it. You either meet people who don't talk at all, or you meet people who do talk and are just down right ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s(this game as I have noticed mostly consists of kids who still think the term "noob" is a legit insult). The community isn't as bad if you don't mind playing with kids who age between 13-17. Now I know there are good people on this game, older or younger. I've met tons of friends on here. Just don't get your hopes up with finding people in game to group with. Oh and the North America support for Elsword is crap compared to Korea where it originated... Just saying:PThe combat can be repetitive if you find doing almost the same thing all of the time repetitive. Now I say almost because, depending on your level, things can get a little spiced up. But it's a 2d sidecroller what else is there to expect right?Those are 2 of my biggest cons, obviously the community being the big ol♥♥♥♥♥♥pile at your school's bathroom it is. I hate playing with people who don't understand that (competitive or not) games are meant to be enjoyed. Lots of kids these days don't get that, and it's quite sad to be honest...Now for the pros:D The game is fun, for me the simplisity of the game is the star of the show. It's something to just sit back and play(if you have friends who play then that really helps). It's not a difficult game unless you want it to be, such as getting into combos, pvp, (which I forgot to mention is also♥♥♥♥♥♥ and etc.The skills and moves you learn are nice and flashy, and there are plenty of classes/characters to choose from. It's overall definetly one of the better side scroller beat em' ups I've played.The verdict? This game is a good time passer and fun for simple gameplay, or another way to put it, good for casual gamers. Would I reccomend this game to others? NO because I have tried in the past and no one I have reccomended it to liked this game haha. Would I reccomend it to myself? YES... I know that's a weird way of putting it but yeah...Anywaysm I thank anyone who read through this review and hope it helps.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 15, 2015
												THIS REVIEW I RATE  PVP AND PVE (PLEASE READ ALL THE WAY)Okay so i played Elsword back in season 2(2013-2014) and i recently a couple months back quit the game, I mained an LK which is one of if not the most underated class in the game. PvP is the main shine of this game and at the moment it is extememly bad, Hit detection is terrible, 13 year olds saying one of these terms "Lagger, u suck, God your bad, etc" Character balance is not there so most of the time in pvp around A-SS Tier you will see Adds, Ara's, Luciels, and Chungs 70% of the time. PvE is fun but the best PvE feature in this game is Henir's which is basically how fast can you defeat all the bosses (Only do this when your Max Level and have the appropriate gear). People also say this game is P2W and i have to kinda disagree, In PvP i have seen people with 1 skill slot and still wreck but if you wanna be viable in PvP you kinda need to buy a skill slot b and to get the most boosts and stats out of your character then its best to get a costume and socket it. Elsword does have plenty of events that gives out free costumes but they are a pretty hefty grind.Overall if you are a PvP type of gamer then stay away from this game as it is Salty, Unbalanced, and sometimes laggy as hell. If you like PvE and PvE only Elsword is quite a fun gamePvP Rating 4/10PvE Rating 7.5/10Since it doesn't excel in both categorys that is why i say not recommended.

content:
Posted: July 31, 2014
												This game is a lot of fun. It's kind of mind numbing. You don't really need to do an strategizing, mostly button mashing. I currently have 2 characters, Eve and Ara and each have their own little perks. It is a bit annoying that you have to do the same dungeon 3-6 times in a row in order to complete certain missions. The Arena matching is a bit unfair. A level 10 can go against a level 30. I think that they should have it where there's only a 5 level difference (i.e. level 10 against level 15 or 5). Other than that it's fun, addicting and you even get your own little pet :)

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 10, 2014
												I am newbie in mmo's, this is the first I ever play good (because is the first my graphics card runs well). Gameplay 8/10I've been playing about 2 hours and I enjoyed a lot. It's not too hard for newbies (like me) and not too easy for experienced players. The fighting system is really simple and dynamic, it allows you to make large combos with decent variants. It is effective but playing and playing may it turns repetitive. I've played several non-mmo plataforms before and I think it's great.The exp and levelups are well balanced. There are a lot of posibilities with many skills to learn and to upgrade. The character balance it's ok, all classes have their way to fight, weakness and strenghts.The plataform system it's like any other.Graphics 9/10I have a computer without graphic card (Intel chipset) and it runs without problems, so, it's basicaly why I chose this game. It have a really low specs that I was looking for. So I can't be too much demanding. It looks very nice for me, anime 3d desing.Story 6/10Very simple history, out of emotion.Personalitazion 5/10The weak point of the game. Having a simple history it would be worth to have high-rate of perzonalitation options. You can't change your character phisically, there are just 5 classes.Muisc 9/10As a music lover, I think music is important to games. This game has great music, being a Korean game it's not surprise to have such great tracks.General 7/10I think i'ts worth to give it a try. Especially if you haven't a dedicated graphics card, because it runs pretty well with my 3100 gma Intel chipset. I like plataforms games and this is great for plataforms lovers. If you are looking to spend moderate daily time playing one mmorpg, you better look for another game, as I said it turns off the fun after 1-2 hours.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 19, 2014
												Well im making another new review to not make people think this game is terrible or anything so i will go into detail as to why i dont consider this game fun anymore but it used to be. Pros: Nice game to play if you into beat em up side-scroller games.A very nice detailed storyline and each character different dialogue.Lots and lots of different costumes to wear to look cool or cute based on preferrance.Okish PvP system if your into Arena and fighting other RL players or Epic NPCs.Still coming out with new stuff to do even if its not appealing to others.Cons: Elitist people in Arena always talking trash or showboating to sound like they the best.Whiners in the game complaining about constant lag (Even in PvE and PvP.)Just lack of people wanting to have fun and take this game way too serious and another level.People spam too much with megaphones that it gets really annoying (Goes back to Con#2)Lack of players queuing endgame secret dungeons to get gear right, only way to get endgame gear is buying with ED which takes awhile to farm up.Alot of different pvpers: Runners, Strategic Runners, Spammers (Doing same actions or combo loops), Trash talkers (I get like this when people annoy me), Trollers (Always tells players to "Git Gud" all the time), and finally Complainers about lag (I deal with lag all the time but never once have complained but others do its sad.)Now i know my pros arent as really clear as my cons but in my personal opinion after having to deal with season 1, season 2 and season 3 arena players people are just way too elite in this game and think they are a cut above the rest and dont consider themselves try hards. If you mash on your keyboard to bunny hop (Basically make your character force down) then you in my eyes are try hards sorry to say. Also their are those that complain constantly about lag this, lag that, your a lagger! Who gives a crap dude? You act like every person on the planet has top notch internet like you if your so pro go and learn to read Korean words and learn their language and go play on their servers and quit making the NA servers so uncomfortable for casual players. But anyways end of my rant if you all who just recently returning or getting into elsword now and can ignore all the cons of this game then this is the game for u. Would i recommend this game to you? Yes and No.

												It quite a simple game with alot of different character selection and weapons, the art is beautiful added along with the music that creates a great experiences all together. The game mostly revolve around doing quests and leveling up, along with a few side quest for pets or material. One problem is that looking good in this game is costly, since 5 dollar gets you about 600/500 credit in the game and a even a shoe cost 200 so if the developers would lower the cost a bit the game would be prefect.The game does alot of speaicl events and offers for the player, like giveaways, 2x drops, etc. In the game you are able to get marry and create guilds (with real money) and certain other things.Overall, it's a great game and I would recommend this to anybody who enjoy mmos and anime.

content:
Posted: January 19, 2016
												 Oh Elsword, you're like a delectable little cupcake. You're so sweet and tasty, but you don't last very long. I love you, but I hate you. You're a game that has fantastic pve, artwork, characters, combat, level design... but for game devs who are surged with an energy for more money ultimately pave the way to their own games demise. You got the looks, you've got the talk, you've got the walk, it's too bad you don't got the respect though. If I seem like an entitled jerk who thinks every game dev owes him something, you're wrong. Nobody owes me anything, nor do I squeeze game devs to make a game beyond their creative limits. All I want from a game, is for it to be good. And this game IS good. What kills it though, is how the devs implement...  Microtransactions...  They go too far here. Not only does it annoy you to no end, but it also limits you to play the game proper. Say for example, you just became a Lord Knight. You just got your new outfit, YOUR new outfit. Now you'd expect that, maybe because you worked so hard that you'd at least keep what you have permanently right? WRONG. You have a minimum of 2 weeks on your new outfit. Wanna know why? Because they want to PREY on your need for customization which this game DESPERATELY needs. So once they've destroyed your pride and you give in to buying stupid outfits, they've won. For them, mission accomplished. You became their  female dog.  Now if that wasn't bad enough, how does a stamina bar sound? Once that bar runs out, no more playing for you. Why? Because it is needed to access dungeons in this game. Dungeon farming is this games rite of passage. It never differs from this formula. PVP is a joke, unblanced and un-fun. I can't think of anything else this game has to talk about. If you want to play in a manga style game, play MapleStory. If you want to get your anime fix, play Sepia Tears for instance, or something else you may come across. This game ain't worth it. And neither are it's costumes. RogueTom gives this game a   5/10  Greed, the downfall of man.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 15, 2015
												THIS REVIEW I RATE  PVP AND PVE (PLEASE READ ALL THE WAY)Okay so i played Elsword back in season 2(2013-2014) and i recently a couple months back quit the game, I mained an LK which is one of if not the most underated class in the game. PvP is the main shine of this game and at the moment it is extememly bad, Hit detection is terrible, 13 year olds saying one of these terms "Lagger, u suck, God your bad, etc" Character balance is not there so most of the time in pvp around A-SS Tier you will see Adds, Ara's, Luciels, and Chungs 70% of the time. PvE is fun but the best PvE feature in this game is Henir's which is basically how fast can you defeat all the bosses (Only do this when your Max Level and have the appropriate gear). People also say this game is P2W and i have to kinda disagree, In PvP i have seen people with 1 skill slot and still wreck but if you wanna be viable in PvP you kinda need to buy a skill slot b and to get the most boosts and stats out of your character then its best to get a costume and socket it. Elsword does have plenty of events that gives out free costumes but they are a pretty hefty grind.Overall if you are a PvP type of gamer then stay away from this game as it is Salty, Unbalanced, and sometimes laggy as hell. If you like PvE and PvE only Elsword is quite a fun gamePvP Rating 4/10PvE Rating 7.5/10Since it doesn't excel in both categorys that is why i say not recommended.

content:
Posted: July 26, 2014
												Elsword is indeed very repetative with many dungeons and quest that can often cause thge player to have frustraitions while playing the game. That however should be no reason to not try this game. Besides being repetative Elsword has plenty of features in game to make the game more fun and also entertaining. One Feature is character customization. The game has many In-Game shops where you can buy accessories and diffrent types of armor for your character. If thats not not enough the game also has a cash shop where you can buy many kinds of costumes  and items that give you mounts and many peices of gear that helps you make many diffrent character customizations. Another two features is pvp and the skill tree. Elsword has a solid base for pvp that allows you to create your own combinations of combos that can knock your opponent down with lightning ast attks to attking your enemy while their in the air with swift skills or slashes from the characters blade. with many skills and combinations to chose from the pvp has a uniqueness of its own. For players that want to get married in game there is a marriage system. The marriage sytem is broken into 4 steps. first you need to find the person you want your character to marry. afterwards you need to buy the couples ring from the cash shop (The item can only be found in the CashShop alone).once you give the ring to the person you want to marry you must wait 3 days (this time can be used to get to know eachother better ). when the time is up you can buy the marriage pakage which will have a certain number of invatations you can send to your friends and a item for using one of the chappels in the game. The final feature i'm going to be speaking of is the world aspect of the game since with all due respect i don't want to waste any more of peoples time.the world aspect may be that it is a side-scroller game but that doesn't mean it doesn't have anything for you to do. this multiplayer game will have you in a single player instance to start with in the beginning but there is more to it. after that one instance you are sent into the open world. you can meet many people, make friends, even for you people that struggle with the dungeons or quest there is a large community of people to help you get through the game.

content:
Posted: December 9, 2014
												Elsword is a fun game, I'll give it that. I've encountered no bugs what-so-ever throughout my entire 45+ hours on this game, and I already have 3 characters. Elsword, who is my main character and a Sword Knight. Chung, who is my tank and secondary character. Add, who is the newest (at the time of writing this review) and my third character, whom I'm still leveling to the same level my Chung is. So far, I haven't even scratched the surface of the game in my entire playtime! In Elsword, you go around completing quests Metroidvania-esque, back and forth on a side-scrolling screen between areas and dungeons. You can play with friends, utilizing the "Friends List" and "Party" features to play with them in dungeons, towns, and in-between. I, personally, play with a few friends while I play. It can be played by yourself, solo, but will still require an internet connection. I wholeheartedly recommend this game, and give it a 10/10!

content:
Posted: July 19, 2014
												i've read that the communities of this game and grand chase arguning because they look similar. Because both characters have red headed swordsman, female elf archers, and purplehaired mages they have an excuse to scream at each other. but where the difference ends. STORY: The story is that a stone called the "El" were stolen by bandits and its up to the el search party to get it back. The story moves on to each village to move the story. The "El stone" story ends at altera when you finish the quest "Tunring everything back to normal." Then story goes to Feita with an demon invasion. The story ark reminds me of certain anime like fairy tail or naruto. 9.75/10CHARACTERS: There are currently 9 characters on both versions. what suprises me about them are that 3/9 characters included demons. Chung, Ara Haan, and Elesis. The character are Elsword, Rena, Aisha, Raven, Eve, Cung, Ara Haan, Elesis, and the insane Add. I like Add the most because of his backstory, gameplay, and personality (reminds me of lasercorm from smosh games). I feel mad for raven, chung, ara, and add. raven betrayed by his fellow soldiers, his fiance and friends died saving him and became a cyborg in the aftermath who u can fight in the first dungeon in altera. Chung's dad got possesed and almost died from severe injuries. ara family got slaughtered by demons and her brother became a demon (Final boss of hamel) and add family got killed (not by demons), sold in slavery and driven insane by isolation. The backstories suprises me with any way. (thank u south korea) 9.80/10GAMEPLAY: By comboing your enimies to oblivion through special/actives skills. When u reach level 15 you'll be able to choose multiple paths. 3 for elsword, rena, aisha, raven, eve, and chung. 2 for ara and elesis and currently 1 for add at the time. You will have to go through a quest line before advancing to the next class or you can spend 200 K-ching and you'll be able use new combos with the chosen class then advance to the 2nd job at level 35. either quest line or pay 400 K-ching you're pick. what i really love about elsword is he final dungeons. The final dungeons supply you EXP for you to level up and a challengin boss. There's a dungeon called henir's time and space which actually a boss rush mode. I've seen videos of player beating it with they're best time. There are also secret dungeons when u get to the level cap (70). However there is a stamina system which is spent on dungeons and hunting in the fields. when all of the stamina runs you can't dungeon untill 3:30 A.M. 9.5/10PVP: The match making..... is absolutley broken. my level 42 elsword is set with a max level elesis. you start playing PVP at level 10 its fine at that lower levels then gone to hell later. 0.01/10COMMUNITY: The only was chatting with other players is either in a guild or in the sparring rooms. 7.89/10CASH SHOP: i can't get enough with the cash shop. costumes. check. quick slot extensions. check. pet adn mounts. check. Inventory expansion. CHECK! 10/10FINAL VERDICT: I love this gams with a passion. I have over 500 hours in to this game and my highest level is a add. combo monsters to oblivion. The gamplay is good. Pvp is below average. The stamina can get annoying but who cares. 9.99/10

content:
Posted: September 18, 2014
												Now this is overall a mixed review of Elsword, as it has its pros cons. I'd like the start with the cons as in my opinion, the cons should come first, (I apologize if this review isn't all that great, it's my first one haha). Okay so where to begin...The community is pretty ♥♥♥♥♥♥ the way I've experienced it. You either meet people who don't talk at all, or you meet people who do talk and are just down right ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s(this game as I have noticed mostly consists of kids who still think the term "noob" is a legit insult). The community isn't as bad if you don't mind playing with kids who age between 13-17. Now I know there are good people on this game, older or younger. I've met tons of friends on here. Just don't get your hopes up with finding people in game to group with. Oh and the North America support for Elsword is crap compared to Korea where it originated... Just saying:PThe combat can be repetitive if you find doing almost the same thing all of the time repetitive. Now I say almost because, depending on your level, things can get a little spiced up. But it's a 2d sidecroller what else is there to expect right?Those are 2 of my biggest cons, obviously the community being the big ol♥♥♥♥♥♥pile at your school's bathroom it is. I hate playing with people who don't understand that (competitive or not) games are meant to be enjoyed. Lots of kids these days don't get that, and it's quite sad to be honest...Now for the pros:D The game is fun, for me the simplisity of the game is the star of the show. It's something to just sit back and play(if you have friends who play then that really helps). It's not a difficult game unless you want it to be, such as getting into combos, pvp, (which I forgot to mention is also♥♥♥♥♥♥ and etc.The skills and moves you learn are nice and flashy, and there are plenty of classes/characters to choose from. It's overall definetly one of the better side scroller beat em' ups I've played.The verdict? This game is a good time passer and fun for simple gameplay, or another way to put it, good for casual gamers. Would I reccomend this game to others? NO because I have tried in the past and no one I have reccomended it to liked this game haha. Would I reccomend it to myself? YES... I know that's a weird way of putting it but yeah...Anywaysm I thank anyone who read through this review and hope it helps.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 24, 2015
												So I think I've wasted enough precious hours to this game to state some glaring problems with it. It's more hours than what Steam says, I started before the Steam greenlight if memory serves.1. Free 2 play, pay 2 win system. The entire cash shop is a joke.2. PvP is broken, especially with new classes and it's full of cheap hoes spamming autotracking skills and the sort3. My experience with the community is generally terribad with trolls leaving mid-match and such4. Absolutely atrocious drop rates of items. I don't know if I was just that unlucky, but I had to constantly redo dungeons for the job advance quests, which consist of annoying, repetitive chores like defeat this boss X times and get Y items. The worst is the combination of those two - get Z of boss drops. So if the random number generator didn't agree with me (which happened a lot), I had do the dungeon all over again. It's all horrible luck based bull that wastes hours of time and stamina, which brings me to the next issue.5. The asinine stamina system. Run out of stamina, can't play any more dungons for the day. Just, why? I decide when to stop playing, not the game.6. KOG's definition of "balance" may greatly differ from yours. Or they may not care at all. Which seems to be the case since these new characters recently are all about "Let's make this class more epic than the last" and end up utterly breaking the gameplay as a result of these obnoxious wanks showing off. Which brings me to the next issue.7. Add. Refer to #2. Haven't touched this game in ages, but I know that adding (no pun intended) one more blatantly overpowered (from what I've seen and heard about him) character isn't a good thing. I don't plan to play this game again just to find out how criminally unbalanced he is.8. Grinding for levels, job advancement, farming for items, pretty much the entire PvE gameplay in general gets stale, boring and repetitive after a while, especially with the stamina system and hyper OP guys running around flexing their PAY2WIN benefits killing any potential enjoyment. Dungeons are as linear as linear can be.9. Weeaboo simulatorHonestly, I can't say that I didn't have some fun with this game. This is a Korean MMO, and Korean MMOs love hyper, epic and flashy combos that with fast paced action can give your eyes quite the colorful seizure. The skills look cool when you're running around beating up stuff and it's mildly exciting with a full party, especially when you're ganging up on bosses whacking the ever living daylights out of them. The game has its moments. It just gets old and routine pretty quickly, especially at higher levels where leveling and quests becomes a little more than a drawn out chore that gets increasingly stretched out by the dumb stamina system. Check it out if you don't mind these issues and the microtransaction advantages, but I personally would just invest my time in a good game.If you like the game, you may want to consider Void Elsword. It's a private server without the BS of NA from what I've heard.

												Elsword is one of the first games i got on steam and i can tell you first hand its a great game but has some problems... Starting off with the good the classes are really cool and all are equally as awsome as the next. Each with a cute backstory i can't find anything wrong with them. number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 26, 2015
												Wost MMO i've played in a LONG time. FREEMIUM and PAY-TO-WIN at its finest. Most free MMOs have paid "cash" items that give cosmetic changes and are made to look cool, but this games cash items actually give stat bonuses, if they work in PvP or not I don't care its still BULL. This game is so bugged out its not even funny: its a combo based game and the enemies will LITERALLY TELEPORT BEHIND YOU breaking your combo, when an enemy teleports behind you another enemy will come up behind you and trap you and combo you to death, the enemies are solid objects so you can't walk by them and you will be knocked down back in between them if you try to jump out from between them which on most maps is a must if you can't stagger or knock back the enemies which enemies won't be, the quest system is buggy and event quests DON'T work properly, the options don't work properly. Now done with the bugs my problems with the game: defaults to windowed mode and the full screen option doesn't work unless it is restarted (which granted is usual for SOME games), its a combo based game, moving from map to map takes forever and is slow, the map is 2D and 3D moving between this is a pain in the rear, its pay-to-win, you can only equip 4 skills if you want more you have to PAY for it, item inventory is tiny to expand it you PAY for it, for the size of the inventory to many items drop basically forcing you to either sell your entire inventory or PAY to have it expanded, the tutorial sucks and doesn't tell anything about the game, the key binds are not obvious and make no sense, the game does an absolute horrible job at showing how much health you have, *the potions are useless and heal nothing its easier to die and respawn right where you died with no penalty or reprocussion because you come back with full health and mana, the UI is not user or beginner friendly at all and the tutorial doesn't help you basically need to come out of the womb knowing how to play this game or look up how to play if you're a beginner, there is a constant tutorial that flashes over your skill set and gets annoying after playing for 4 hours telling me to hit left CTL for a skill that does really nothing, my first time playing it froze the minute I got to the starting town cause my friend sent me a party and friend invite then it froze again randomly in the middle of playing but this time it came back. I love MMORPGs but this is the WORST I have played, absolute garbage and horse dung. probably will NEVER PLAY AGAIN. Only reason why I played is because me and my friend made a deal to play each others MMOs with each other for a week. In short: God this was utter trash and a NIGHTMARE to play I never want to play again nor probably never will.*I was playing Add which is supposidly a "mage class" apparently this mage has more health than normal mages in otther MMOs because i used a potion that healed 4500hp and barely healed a 5th of my hp and this game DOESN'T show your max HP so its hard to tell how much you have so you just need to guess how much HP you have, and the potions are on a 60 second cool down. 60 SECONDS even if you have 3 DIFFERENT potions on your quick slots they ALL go on cooldown, if the potions REGENED health it would be a different story or if there is no cooldown for the others it would be fine.

content:
Posted: April 21, 2014
												To start off, let's do a quick summary of what Elsword is:Elsword is a Anime Styled, Side Scrolling, Free to Play, Class-based RPG Fighter in which you are given the choice of 9 different characters to fight with, level up and "evolve" so to say. Each character has different skill trees which can be chosen to fit your personal gameplay style. Like to play as a Free Knight and acquire pyromancer abilities? Choose Elesis! Like being a Tank for your team? Choose Chung! How about being an Archer to attack from long range? Choose Rena! This selection of characters is great for all kinds of players and helps broaden the audience for this game. It has typical elements which you can expect from an RPG: Armour, Special weapons, potions, grinding etc. These elements fit well into the world of Elsword, helping you defeat bosses in dungeons to earn XP and gain better armour and weapons!Speaking of bosses, there may be repetition with such bosses as Banthus but besides that, they are both challenging and rewarding. The game itself seems to get very addicting when you are trying to level up your character and get them to their next form or "evolution" as I've said before. The stamina bar is used to prevent addiction. This bar is gradually used up as you complete dungeons and once you are out of stamina you cannot do any more dungeons for the day. Stamina is refilled every day though as well as having unlimited stamina at weekends so all you fanatics can play to your hearts content.In closing, I believe Elsword is a fun, vibrant and addicting game and I recommend it to all of you anime or RPG lovers.

content:
Posted: April 18, 2014
												Honestly the concept has promise but between the NA publisher's increasing drive to get people to cash, and the general incompetence (class balance, updates screwing things up, etc), I really must say: Turn back now. (I've since stopped playing)Some Pluses:the exp rates are reasonable now (surprisingly)PvE Community is tolerant of Underpowered classes.The game itself is pretty fun (before you hit stat bloatville known as Sander)NegativesCommunity is insanely greedy (even worse than before with people tradining large amounts of KChing for stuff)The publisher does do nothing towards keeping the economy in linePvP community is quick to make hacking accusationsIn game events tend to be bleh if not frustratingThings are generally much worse/cash heavy compare to KR (99% of skill notes are now cash shop only)Wonky class imbalance (not as bad as Marvel vs Capcom 2 but the OP and UP classes are pretty obvious)And for those that are interested in its beat'em up mechanics: KoG is pushing the game towards being a maple story clone and the game's design basically punishes some classes.Again I can only recommend not playing this. Play Castle Crashers instead for example or wait until DFOG beta begins.

												Seriously this is just like every other side-scrolling MMO there is, this is Grand Chase. I'm not sure how this game stacks up against others as it's the first I've played. I thought I'd give it a try. When I first joined the game I had a lot of fun for a couple hours, then I realized this game is the definition of repetitive. Seriously guys, dungeon after dungeon, killing something after something. I couldn't handle this. If that's your style, I'd definitely recommend this game. It has a few aspects I like, combat is pretty fun and the "comic book" feel is kind of charming. Not the greatest game (perhaps it's the genre I dislike). 6.5/10.

content:
Posted: January 9, 2015
Quick SummaryA fun localized MMORPG that consists of pressing Z.Purchase Verdict: Free and worth trying.Points of Interest-There is a limit to how much you can play (approximately 4 hours a day) during the week. (Due to deaths of players who marathon games and don't eat, sleep, or go to the bathroom.) This limit is removed during the weekends.-Plenty of different characters, who progress through various jobs (classes) as you level up.-Nice art style, and semi-interesting story.-Not necessarily Pay-to-Win, but more serious players may find themselves at a disadvantage if they don't pay for some things.-In my experience, community is large, but not many people communicate.

content:
Posted: April 20, 2016
												A very fun game, i prefer to use the game launcher from the website but you can go either way.This game has pros and cons but is very enjoyable if you dont mind doing the same dungeon 3-4 times over and over again as it does indeed get old But lets get on to the pros and cons.Pros:-Very enjoyable for something in your off time.-PvE is enjoyable. -A nice leveling scale as it gets pretty difficult for 60-85 (I found it quite difficult)-Nice idea of job changes for each character which supplies a character with new combos and skills making it a very refreshing game if you like to do the main story over again just to try out each characters job change (each job change has a 2nd version which makes it gain more skills and combos).-Manages to pull off a good anime style type of game.-Side scrolling beat em up MMoRPG thats enjoyable.Cons:-PvP is Unbalanced (Basically PTW).-Repetitive.-New classes tend to be more powerfull then the old ones.-Can get insanely boring later on in the higher levels trying to get to 85.And thats pretty much it, there isnt really anything else about this game other than its enjoyable for awhile but gets boring near the middle of the game and the pvp is pretty unbalanced most of the times, but its a must play if you enjoy playing through dungeons over and over again or like making people salty in pvp (Beause NA is salty AF).

content:
Posted: October 5, 2014
												At first i love Elsword, it was a cute side scroller and the dungeons were actually pretty fun... then i got into the pvp or arena as they call it and i absolutely hated it. Elswords Arena is the most broken pvp in a online rpg i have ever experienced. The new character ADD can hit you once then constantly stun lock you until your hp drops or they fail the combo which is highly unlikely as it is just  a mashing of zzzz or xxxx constantly. Add is not the only op character that they have. Aisha's Elemental Master Job can literally just teleport all over the map gaining mp constantly to spam her most powerful skills where your stuck there chasing her the entire game. Eve's Battle Seraph job is just one big spam fest. Basically this games pvp lacks fairness and is generally just made up of spamming, running, and over powered characters compared to the others. I would not recommend this game as the dungeons while they may be fun get boring super quick then your left with a lack luster arena filled with overpowered characters.

content:
Posted: November 26, 2013
												By far one of the best cel-shaded games I've played since Tales of Symphonia! Only problem is the Stamina System. I understand it is Korean Law to limit the play time for koreans but that shouldn't apply for international servers, especially the NA server. With my job I have anywhere between 4 days to a month worth of time off and I like to spend that time playing video games, which I love Elsword but limiting how much I can play it on one character is a little drastic. If a private server came out of Elsword that removed this horrible feature, I would join it and give them my money in a heartbeat. Otherwise, a reluctant thumbs up for Elsword.*Note* The graphics/gameplay is fantastic, the only con I have for this game is the Stamina System in place.

content:
Posted: September 28, 2014
												This a interesting game with a nice story line. When I first started playing it reminded me of super smash bros, but with the mmo aspect combined with huge numbers, that feel so satisfing when you see them. It is relativly easy to lvl up, and there are many combos, and abilities you can use and get. The PvP is kinda broken at first, but when you start going up the raks it is easier to fight, and find a good match for you. This is a MMO, so you need people to beat dungeons. The dungeons are easy at first, but they get insanly harder to do,  I tried to solo the whole game, and it has been working till now, however it gets ever so harder for me because of the bosses (some of the most agravating bosses I have ever faced in mmos). But over all this game is extremely addicting, and if you are a mmo player you should definitly try this out.

content:
Posted: November 26, 2013
												By far one of the best cel-shaded games I've played since Tales of Symphonia! Only problem is the Stamina System. I understand it is Korean Law to limit the play time for koreans but that shouldn't apply for international servers, especially the NA server. With my job I have anywhere between 4 days to a month worth of time off and I like to spend that time playing video games, which I love Elsword but limiting how much I can play it on one character is a little drastic. If a private server came out of Elsword that removed this horrible feature, I would join it and give them my money in a heartbeat. Otherwise, a reluctant thumbs up for Elsword.*Note* The graphics/gameplay is fantastic, the only con I have for this game is the Stamina System in place.
