content:
Posted: July 6, 2015
												I was a little bit hesitant to download this, but once I started playing I instantly fell in love.  This game is great, although everything is a bit confusing to learn without using guides or anything.  Player progression and upgrading your gear feels very rewarding, not just something you feel like you have to do. Here are some pros and cons of this game:Pros:-Great gameplay-Doesn't require a great computer-Very little chat spam-Guild system(which I have yet to fully experience)-Very smooth and fast paced combatCons:-The story line gets a little repetitive-Confusing to understand everything without guidesOver all the game is great and I plan to continue playing it.  I would recommend trying this game out.  Also I will note that both of the cons are minor issues and don't affect the overall quality of the gameplay that much.Thanks for reading,-Polar

content:
Posted: October 18, 2015
												Elsword is an older MMORPG where you play as one of 10+ characters and go on a journey to defeat demons.The gameplay is a bit sticky at first, but you can easily get used to it. The PVE is a bit boring at times, but the PVP is where it really shines. It acts as sort of a fencing type game where if you land a hit, you need to know how to chain into other attacks.The characters each have their own personalities, and are unique in some ways or another. The game has equal fanservice between characters aswell, mostly leaning more towards males, but overall it isn't that kind've sexualization you see in other games.The music is pretty catchy at some parts, and isn't too bad, but like other games, you'll eventually want to turn it off. I keep mine on because I can ignore it.The game has a way of keeping your level the same as the area you're in, but it forces you to do the same dungeons over and over at later levels. This is both useful, but annoying at the same time.Overall, I say the game is about a 7.5-8/10. The game knows how to easily avoid P2W, and still allows you to acquire some things by using only microtransactions during events. So Elsword is COMPLETELY free.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 24, 2015
												Hello there. c: Well then, Where can I start? Elsword is a fun MMORPG game. Not the typical "Create your character the way you want it to look like!" Actually, that comes later. Instead, they give you several of characters to choose from, each having a different story, and three different routes to choose from. (Classes for example, If you choose Elesis, you have three Classes to choose from, each being different in their own special way, and having different combos.) The Good, Neutral, then Evil Route (In my opinion.) This is a slide scroller game, during Dungeons, and level grinding isn't that hard (During the weekends) Yet during the weekdays watch out from your Will/Stamina. Once you reach 0%, you may no longer play with that character. Yes you have the option to create more characters! Not just one, except there is a limit (I believe 6?) Now, as for customization, in this category it is a Pay - To - Win game. The customization gear comes with high stats to help improve your character to become "better" This is mostly used for PvP as well, yet in my opinion I would say to stay away from the PvP Community, because it's very cancerous (AKA stupid and annoying) If you're with friends, I would recommend this game because it's just really funny to see when people get♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥off. x'DFrom what I see in the community in general, if you don't pay to win, your character sucks. A lot.And it's true. For a B-Slot, you have to pay for that. If you mess up with your character skills, you have to pay for a restoration potion. Karma Koins are very expensive, seeing how $25 won't even give you a full costume. Probably a weapon and b-slot. Also, My IGN is Psychotropia (Or is it Psychotropic? I forget since I haven't played in a while.) I was a winner from one of Elsword's contests that they hold on their Facebook page. They gave me 400 K-Ching, which really isn't anything and you're most likely better off buying ice burners, yet that's gambling. So even 400 K-Ching won't get you anywhere. (That's saying something if you wanted to be cheap and input less money. Cause your wallet will most likely be empty if you play this game.)In short, Elsword is a Pay - To - Win game, I would recommend this game to those who don't mind spending money on a game. Eventually, you create a character, and you're bound someday or another to put in money. That's how I see it.I hope you guys have fun if you play this game. ; ^ ;

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 25, 2015
												I've been playing this game for about half a year now, and to sum it up in a general statement: the game is enjoyable as a side-scrolling RPG.Pros.-overall good community-fast playthroughs concerning dungeons (good for beginning a new character)-Good amount of events-Dont have to empty your wallet in order to be good-good handful of characters which have multiple different play stylesCons.-KoG needs to do some balancing of characters for the NA servers, not quite as smooth for certain dungeons when with other players.-Since the merge of communities rowdiness in PVP has skyrocketed (Whining complaining hassling etc.)It's a game kids. Relax.-FPS gets a very glitchy especially in situations such as henir and 3P-V-3P (Solution for the earlier note: find a program to help your FPS increase, Cortex for example- it'll decrease the whining about "hackers" cause you're probably facing someone with a better pc or is using a program like so because they're sick of the glitching.)And finally: -yes, sometimes a quest can be too repetitive- yes this could also be a positive thing when it comes to earning locked skills and extras for those dedicated to a character for a guild or just a general favorite, but it can also hinder progress in certain parts of the storyline.However despite the minor negatives it is still a very enjoyable game, allowing you to create a character which really fits your play syle. Whether you're into pro/casual gaming means nothing towards recomendation for this game, either way it's still enjoyable, and hope you have a blast.Rating: 9/10

content:
Posted: August 13, 2015
												You like manga/anime themed art styles? Of course you do that's why you're here right? Ok anyways it's a very smooth 2.5D fighting game. Think mmo Smash Bros. (Has anyone played Viewtiful Joe)? But yeah the crafting system is pretty easy to get the hang of and the community is excellent so give it about an hour of play and see what you like after all it is free-to-play.  Speaking of which, lets talk about that for a sec, you dont need to worry about pay to win because this game showers you in events for all sorts of goodies. This can also be a negative thing though because your storage is, in my opinion, wayyyy to small to begin with. PvP is ALRIGHT not perfect though. I like to think of pvp as Super Smash Bros. with friends but with PRIZES. Also pvp lobbies are  used as a chatroom often so thats kind of cool. The game music is pretty freakin awesome by the way, you can tell they know what they're doing when it comes to setting the musical mood for a good butt kickin. Anyways back to the graphics the manga-themed aesthetic is really pleasent for anime fans to look at but  some of you simply might not enjoy that art style so it could impact your feelings, but hey, thats fine because if you're still reading this then chances are you already feel comfortable with the art.Another nice thing about this game is it doesn't take up much space on your hard drive. In fact it doesn't require you to have a super nice computer. Minimum requirements is 256MB of RAM and 32MB of VRAM. Cpu speed needs at least 800MHz.     Recommended however would be 512MB RAM 128MB of VRAM and 2.7GHz of Cpu speed. So I would probably give it a 8/10 for general judgement, and a 9/10 for my own personal biased judgement  (ANIME themed 2.5D fighter!)TL;DR  Anime Fighter like Super Smash Bros, but with PvE elements a good fighter game to take casually that also has a nice sound track.

content:
Posted: September 21, 2015
												I've been playing this game for a couple years now so what the hell, i'll write a review.  First off, the whole "Pay to win" nonsense other people seem to be claiming is completely false.  B-Slots (allows you to use more skills) are sold in the marketplace in-game along with magic necklaces (increased MP gain).  Costumes are also sold on the board in-game, or you could find K-ching sellers for nearly anything else you could want in the cash shop.  Now that that's out of the way, the game itself is kind of repetitive, but dungeons do look different and bosses do have different mechanics.  Leveling is easy to do offering multiple ways to do it (Dungeons, Fields, Ereda Island).  That about covers PvE.  PvP is another story.  Some classes are god-tier and some are please-put-me-out-of-my-misery tier.  Easy characters to use would include Add/Ara/Luciel/Elesis(maybe).  Harder to use characters would include Elsword/Aisha (Masochist? Good. This is the char for you.)/Raven.  Summed up, this game is pretty cool if you're into the whole 2D Sidescrolling thing.  It does have it's balance issues, but what game that involves PvP doesn't?7/10

Posted: January 9
												The endgame doesn't have much going for it.  I can respect KOG's efforts by hosting a multitude of events in order to keep the game fresh, yet even these become repetitive.  Said events don't accomplish much besides giving rewards that most players who have played for a substantial amount time have already stockpiled.The game also suffers in the fact that despite being able to create and collect any amount of characters you want, said characters aren't exactly usable until you pass a certain paywall, seeing that most items (such as skill pages and skill slot change medals) are one per character.It can be entertaining, but I don't see it remaining that way no matter who you are.xd

content:
Posted: March 5, 2016
												Okay, I have years of experience off of Steam. Four accounts, a billion characters, and hundreds of dollars wasted on K-Ching. Just gonna let that float before you go judging my small amount of hours of Steam Elsword.This game has taken my life, money and my ability to convince people into liking the things I like.This is legitimately my favorite game. I have had multiple computers in the past, and I always downloaded Elsword first (behind only a better browser, of course). Slight grind, but that's what I love about it. I love all the different outfits you get from quests and dungeons, and I love just killing monsters and the feeling that comes with it.PROS-Nice community-You can find anyone- MEGAPHONES-Private chat with your buds-BASICALLY EVERYTHING-Oh, they have a great story, and everything leads to one another-I love the characters!CONS-Usually, the latest characters are the best choice, but other than that, most things are equalized to me-Slight grind, but who cares?-Yup that's about it.This game has basically been my lifeline for the past couple of years. When I'm bored, Elsword. When I'm not bored, Elsword. No matter what, Elsword. I love the outfits in the Item Mall. I love begging for money to get K-Ching with. I just wish that it was slightly less pricey. Sheesh mate, you think I'm freaking rich? Plus, every character basically has a name the has at least a slight resemblance to. Eve. MY NAME STARTS WITH EVE.I love how the characters look. I JUST LOVE THEM. Eve x Add FTW.tl;dr: The point I'm trying to get across here is, don't do drugs.Just joking. I want the Elsword community to grow. YOU GUYS CAN DO THAT, IF YOU COULD ONLY TRUST ME! Nobody inmy class does. Oh, that's the last con. Getting people you know to play Elsword. Sheesh, stubborn little ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s.THANK YOU!10/10 IGN, M8!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 1, 2015
												Final Score: 8/10This online MMO (mmorpg) has a lot of things going for it. The storyline is interesting and there's plenty of ways to upgrade and skill your chosen character. I'll admit that I’ve played this game for many hours and if you're looking into whether or not getting this game, I would recommend you do. Pros:Many updates with new maps and charactersFun communityGuildsPlenty of things you can purchase to make yourself stand out in the communityFairly entertaining fighting systemGreat skill systemCons.Needs more characters with completed skill trees available.Needs more diverse mapsMore various fighting styles (no same button mashing techniques)My only real complaint with the game is playing through each map gets very, very repetitive. In a perfect world, I would have more of an open experience with the maps with a more diverse way of how to play through them. I understand that this is a hack and slash game, but when you only hack and slash on a side scroller through the same locations, it gets old.Otherwise, this is a great Free To Play Game!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 16
												Honestly this game does get alot of well deserved flack, and for good reason, however because I have played alot and on two seperate servers, I will go into great detail why this game is worth your time, but not to much of your time.Firstly the combat is realitively simple to get to grips with, however the depth comes when applying skills, combos, and even class play styles and changes into the mix. Each character is fairly uniqe, minus the EL siblings, and all play diffrently to one and other.Elsword: standard sword play with a gauge that rewards you for switching your combo attacks and grants bonuses for skills, has a job path that increases sword skill, a job path that adds magic projectiles and fire to the mix, and a job path that gives you a second sword that can shred through enemys.Aisha: Standard mage, nothing much more then that, 1 job path gives you more elemental magic, the second one gives you some destructive dark magic, and the third one gives you "Kawaii Magic Girl" powers (this job is cancer in pvp)Rena: the ranger that will kick things, one job gives more arrow combos, one gives more kicks, the other gives traps and a sword.Raven (personal favorite): Slice enemys apart with your sword then blast em to peices with your Nasod (robot) arm, one job improves your Nasod arm punches, One improves you sword skills (recomended), and the final one gives you overheat abbilitys with various buffs and debuffs.Eve: comand various Nasod's with basic comands and use electricity to harm enemys, one job gives you servents, one job gives you tools of destruction (and a tank), and the third makes you shoop da woop.Chung: small kid with gaint dual end canon, you can smack the crap out of people or blow the up with canon fire. One job makes you smacking stronger, one gives you smaller lighter pistols while boosting your movement, and one gives you grenades mortors and a LOT of rockets.Ill finish writing this later and doing the other characters. overall worth your time so long as you dont go into pvp.

number of helpful: 4 of 10 people (40%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 19, 2015
												Elsword for a game that is 2.5D/3D-esque anime style MMORPG. The voices are in japanese which is fine and a really easy style of combat to use. You have a variety of characters to choose from and each comes with their own abilities and difficulty style. The game is really fun to play and can immerse you for many hours while you level up, select your skills and make them more powerful using skill points. The game does have an item mall where you can spend real money converted into K-Ching to get special items, class upgrades, costumes with stats that increase as you level up. The down side to the item mall is that you have to choose if you want the items you purchase from there to be permanent or temporary (idk why you want a trial run of the item but I know some people do for some reason. My opinion is get the items you want as a permanent keeper). The story is quite good and entertaining with cutscene's and intro that actually shows you how to start off. Anyone wanting to play a side scrolling rpg this is the game for you. I hope you enjoy playing the game or will join the game and start your own adventure. Have fun and yes this is my First Review on Steam.

number of helpful: 4 of 10 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 24, 2016
												Oh look it's a game by kog, who made grand chase.and its pay to win, just like grand chase.theres $180 worth of dlc on a f2p game, that should tell you more than enough about how♥♥♥♥♥♥this game is.this game offers skill slot enlargers for paying, straight up stat upgrades that a full set can have major changes on your weapon, and a fast track on crafting that will allow you to outlevel everyone elses gear with eaze just so long as you invest enough money into the game.what else?pvp is a joke, sets you against random players of varying levels (their stats aren't scaled up or down based on yours) making for very 1 sided fights. its also a lag fest and my god, is it horrid for a combo driven game.pve is repetative and not very fun after just a short period of time. bosses are interesting but theres just way too much wrong with this game. grand chase i feel was just better than it in every area, but was hindered by a p2w system that ultimately killed the game for a vast majority of people.also, god knows why but elsword fanboys think pay 2 win means that you just straight up with for paying. This would mean all of like 2 games ever released were pay to win, but in reality, that term just means paying for an advantage over another player. "skill" does not render the game not pay 2 win, rather it reinforces how little they understand game design and balance, and its so blindly clear they are fanboying too hard. For refence, there are tons of games that you can conquere pay 2 win elements with enough of a skill gab, notable games include combat arm, wolf team, gun the second duel, and many many others. The game is p2w, its an unarguable fact.for reference, a non pay to win game is something like dota, hon, hots, lol (to a lesser extent due to the unlock system) and certain rpg like lotr, path of exile and many others. they offer either just exp boosts or travel boosts as a maximum advantage, which speeds up the game, but does not influence the balance of the game.

content:
Posted: October 11, 2014
												It's ok and has some character and even has A paladin named Chung which is what I always play first and foremost, but lacks replay value and is mostly 10-12 year olds; which makes the community very unwelcoming and childish.  Don't be mistaken by hours played.  I played this game outside of steam.PROSCharacter classes are unique = my fav was Paladin capable class "CHUNG"Combos are kind of fun.Quests at first are fun and easy to get some ok gear.Store has some nice looking skinsCool visualsCONSGrinding fest once higher levels becomes a bit taxing and not worth it.Combos in this fashion are a bit outdated.Quests are repititive and maps are same maps as before just different colors and maybe 1-2 unique changes, but otherwise the same. Boring factor 7/10 at minimum.The DEVS and Support do not back their products.  Out of myself and a dozen other friends 10 of us out of 13 had purchasing issues ....currency not showing up, items NOT in queue = once you buy the currency = auto bought all items and it's supposed to prompt for confirmation, even a couple instances of buying one thing and recieving something else and quite a few other store bugs, BUT WHAT IS WORSE IS THEY DO NOT REFUND THEIR ERRORS.  Unless you fight through paypal you have no chance of refund.  Unless of course you pay your bank fees or Credit card fees to cancel payment.Game for the most part runs smoothly and I never lagged hardly ever, but when it does it's the worst ever!Lack of real fixes to the game that are neededNew content looks like things prviously just different colors and 1-2 unique addsEND GAME = pretty boring, uneventful and quick to completeGame needs more contentAll in all I give it about a 4/10 ...if they make it to where it plays as well with a Keboard s it is with a Controller = 5/10 ...if game mechanics fix = 6/10...I had fun, but it lasted only for a brief time = MORE CONTENT

												Elsword is anime style 2.5D side scrolling MMORPG that is free to play.  Similar to Dungeon Fighter Online.  It worked, played ok, sounded ok, looked ok.  It has 10 characters you can play, each with different 3 classes, with an extension of each class. The game has normal dungeons and secret dungeons that are HARDER.(lvl70). Game has PVP.For more info:

												This game was kind of fun to play, but the fact that you have to pay real money to actually have more skill slots and be able to do more after lvl 15-20 is ridiculous, you won't have enough inventory space for anything, the bank space is extremely small. 												I love this game. The diversity of characters and their differing powers, as well as the similar controls through the different character platforms is really great. number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 11, 2015
												Yes I may have a lot of hours but I am going to have to rep this one down I'm sorry... KoG staff are amazingly friendly you meet awesome people on this game it has a lot of cool features unique fighting styles cool character combos etc but this games community is just sh*t. I'm sorry but the pvp matches are uselly stacked in one way or another with freeze, poisen, burn etc and after that constant spam with no skill what so ever.It makes me sad that Elsword is not the game it could've been I think we have KoG to blame for the community it's not very well maintained even after PvP revamp if anything it just got worse.and alot of the time the game just breaks randomly so that you constantly have to fix your game with all these errors thats stressful when your in limited edition events and you have to be online for 1 hour just to recieve the event items when you actually spend 2 days trying to fix the stupid errorsThe game is overpriced and a lot about it could be fixedBut honestly some of the best people in my life I've met off this game even if that sounds stupid and cheesy

content:
Posted: September 26, 2016
												My account was banned for some ungodly reason yet they still felt it was okay to take money for a game I could no longer play. This is absolutely inexcusable and totally ridiculous. Where do you get off as a publisher thinking this is okay? Aeria games, you are a disgrace to honest game publishers and developers everywhere. It's disgusting that publishers like you still exist in these modern times that still exploit players and then shed a blanket of ignorance over yourselves. These are YOUR games, these are YOUR responsibility! If something happens with an account do you not think it would be wise to notify the player of the problem, and then maybe I don't know, STOP taking their money? Where does it make sense to decide that you no longer want a player in your community but it's still okay for said player to continue making payments to your asinine company and you continue to profit? What service are you exactly providing to that individual? Or are you just so godly that you think you deserve recompense for some imagined slight? You are disgusting and I will make sure to notify everyone and anyone of your underhanded tactics and exploitations of your playerbase. Thank you Aeria Games for being a shining example of everything wrong with the gaming world and FTP companies today. Thank you for setting back the evolution of the FTP model, and not progressing towards a more streamlined and player friendly model. May god have mercy on your despicable souls...I'm out.JaycePS: Your welcome for all the free money.

content:
Posted: September 28, 2013
												Elsword's a pretty decent game. It's one of the very few games I've played throughout 19 years or so as a gamer that's excited me to the point of sweating in my seat. However, it has several downfalls.Pros:- Fast, exciting gameplay- Interesting character versatilityCons:- Can be buggy- Community*- Several "non-characters" **- Grindfests* Once upon a time, people came to games for the fun of it. It's very rare to find someone in this game who still does. Most of the people you meet will be degenerates, either despairing for something or complaining to KoG directly because their character isn't winning all the time. Very few people realize Elsword is for fun.90% of the people in the game hate playing and only want to win89% of them will say "get good" after running away from you and losing70% of them are proudly filth-minded40% of them are roleplayers30% of them are decently capable in-game0.7% of them like playing the game for the fun of it** Because of the number of tween weebs out there who like to let their character play the game FOR them instead of putting effort into having a good time, KoG has been adding what I like to call "non-characters" since 2014, starting with a bieber-like yugioh filler character named "Add". Each new character features gameplay where the player runs away and occasionally presses a button to initiate an attack which, as mentioned before, plays the game for them.

content:
Posted: December 24, 2015
												I read a few of the reviews and honestly it seems like people just want to hate on it. This game is a brilliantly built game, leveling is honestly fun, plus the 3 dungeon re-do allows you to hone your skills and rank up each time. Early level players get given some great gear and late level players are able to earn fantastic gear just by doing dungeons. PvP may be more geared toward "pay to play" but honestly you can dominate with enough skill. Play safe and smart.

content:
Posted: March 15, 2015
												I LOVE anime rpg's, and with the new class path for ADD (My favourite character) releasing soon, I feel I have to hug my computer screen with thoughts of how the new class path will be like.Pros:^^^^^Multible playable characters you can costumize.^^^^Great combat system^^Sidequests feel like they are worth the grind^^^Great NPC's^^^^^^^^Great storyline^^Pets^^^^^^^^^^YOU CAN BE F$%KING ADD FOR F$%KS SAKE, ADD!!!!Sadly... this game has cons to...Cons:!!!!!If you want to speedrun, you can't, enemies seem strong further.!Some enemies have to be beaten with a group.!!!Towns can get a little hard to remember.!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!PVP has cocky players that when you get beaten by, tell you to "Git gud, scrub."!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!Costumes disappear after a week (except accessories)And thats all I can say about the game so far... Did you enjoy my review? Leave your opinion below, I can deal with good OR bad, I want to know!

Posted: August 29, 2013
												Very good game for a free to play. + most classes have easy to combo abilities+ good graphics and gameplay+ fun dialogue+ alot of different enemies and dungeons+ rather huge game world, a lot of things to do.+ "achievements" (titles)- game can be played for free on most classes, but to get all out of some classes, you need to buy a 4 skill slot upgrade from cash shop. Still, not having B slot is a disadvantage on every class.- daily quests.. the only one I like is time & space one.- quests can get a bit repetitive in my opinion.9/10

content:
Posted: January 7, 2015
												This is a fun game with a cool style and nice artwork, but my one problem is how overly expensive everything is, from things in the cash shop to the inflation of ED nothing is cheap and if you want good stuff be ready to say bye to your entire bank account. I also disagree with most of these reviews because no, its not really a grindfest, you may need to play a dungeon an extra time or two just to get that bit of exp you need and nothing is "required" for you to progress through the game, you do not need to play pvp (it sucks anyway with all the add's) and all this game requires is your time to play it. Also the characters are not that unbalaced, sometimes they can be but they get nerfed and saying that one character is not as good as another in pvp because some characters are not ment for pvp use, rather used for dungeons and the only reason people say characters are unbalanced is because they keep losing to other people and get butthurt because they just are not good at pvp.
